    5382           1 : "    adjacent freed chunks, resulting in larger free chunks and less\n" +
    5383           1 : "    fragmentation.\n" +
    5384           1 : "\n" +
    5385           1 : "    To simplify use in double-linked lists, each bin header acts\n" +
    5386           1 : "    as a malloc_chunk. This avoids special-casing for headers.\n" +
    5387           1 : "    But to conserve space and improve locality, we allocate\n" +
    5388           1 : "    only the fd/bk pointers of bins, and then use repositioning tricks\n" +
    5389           1 : "    to treat these as the fields of a malloc_chunk*.\n" +
    5390           1 : "*/\n" +
    5391           1 : "\n" +
    5392           1 : "typedef struct malloc_chunk* mbinptr;\n" +
    5393           1 : "\n" +
    5394           1 : "/* addressing -- note that bin_at(0) does not exist */\n" +
    5395           1 : "#define bin_at(m, i) ((mbinptr)((char*)&((m)->bins[(i)<<1]) - (SIZE_SZ<<1)))\n" +
    5396           1 : "\n" +
    5397           1 : "/* analog of ++bin */\n" +
    5398           1 : "#define next_bin(b)  ((mbinptr)((char*)(b) + (sizeof(mchunkptr)<<1)))\n" +
    5399           1 : "\n" +
    5400           1 : "/* Reminders about list directionality within bins */\n" +
    5401           1 : "#define first(b)     ((b)->fd)\n" +
    5402           1 : "#define last(b)      ((b)->bk)\n" +
    5403           1 : "\n" +
    5404           1 : "/* Take a chunk off a bin list */\n" +
    5405           1 : "#define unlink(P, BK, FD) {                                            \\n" +
    5406           1 : "  FD = P->fd;                                                          \\n" +
    5407           1 : "  BK = P->bk;                                                          \\n" +
    5408           1 : "  FD->bk = BK;                                                         \\n" +
    5409           1 : "  BK->fd = FD;                                                         \\n" +
    5410           1 : "}\n" +
    5411           1 : "\n" +
    5412           1 : "/*\n" +
    5413           1 : "  Indexing\n" +
    5414           1 : "\n" +
    5415           1 : "    Bins for sizes < 512 bytes contain chunks of all the same size, spaced\n" +
    5416           1 : "    8 bytes apart. Larger bins are approximately logarithmically spaced:\n" +
    5417           1 : "\n" +
    5418           1 : "    64 bins of size       8\n" +
    5419           1 : "    32 bins of size      64\n" +
    5420           1 : "    16 bins of size     512\n" +
    5421           1 : "     8 bins of size    4096\n" +
    5422           1 : "     4 bins of size   32768\n" +
    5423           1 : "     2 bins of size  262144\n" +
    5424           1 : "     1 bin  of size what's left\n" +
    5425           1 : "\n" +
    5426           1 : "    The bins top out around 1MB because we expect to service large\n" +
    5427           1 : "    requests via mmap.\n" +
    5428           1 : "*/\n" +
    5429           1 : "\n" +
    5430           1 : "#define NBINS              96\n" +
    5431           1 : "#define NSMALLBINS         32\n" +
    5432           1 : "#define SMALLBIN_WIDTH      8\n" +
    5433           1 : "#define MIN_LARGE_SIZE    256\n" +
    5434           1 : "\n" +
    5435           1 : "#define in_smallbin_range(sz)  \\n" +
    5436           1 : "  ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(sz) < (CHUNK_SIZE_T)MIN_LARGE_SIZE)\n" +
    5437           1 : "\n" +
    5438           1 : "#define smallbin_index(sz)     (((unsigned)(sz)) >> 3)\n" +
    5439           1 : "\n" +
    5440           1 : "/*\n" +
    5441           1 : "  Compute index for size. We expect this to be inlined when\n" +
    5442           1 : "  compiled with optimization, else not, which works out well.\n" +
    5443           1 : "*/\n" +
    5444           1 : "static int largebin_index(unsigned int sz) {\n" +
    5445           1 : "  unsigned int  x = sz >> SMALLBIN_WIDTH;\n" +
    5446           1 : "  unsigned int m;            /* bit position of highest set bit of m */\n" +
    5447           1 : "\n" +
    5448           1 : "  if (x >= 0x10000) return NBINS-1;\n" +
    5449           1 : "\n" +
    5450           1 : "  /* On intel, use BSRL instruction to find highest bit */\n" +
    5451           1 : "#if defined(__GNUC__) && defined(i386)\n" +
    5452           1 : "\n" +
    5453           1 : "  __asm__(\"bsrl %1,%0\\n\\t\"\n" +
    5454           1 : "          : \"=r\" (m)\n" +
    5455           1 : "          : \"g\"  (x));\n" +
    5456           1 : "\n" +
    5457           1 : "#else\n" +
    5458           1 : "  {\n" +
    5459           1 : "    /*\n" +
    5460           1 : "      Based on branch-free nlz algorithm in chapter 5 of Henry\n" +
    5461           1 : "      S. Warren Jr's book \"Hacker's Delight\".\n" +
    5462           1 : "    */\n" +
    5463           1 : "\n" +
    5464           1 : "    unsigned int n = ((x - 0x100) >> 16) & 8;\n" +
    5465           1 : "    x <<= n;\n" +
    5466           1 : "    m = ((x - 0x1000) >> 16) & 4;\n" +
    5467           1 : "    n += m;\n" +
    5468           1 : "    x <<= m;\n" +
    5469           1 : "    m = ((x - 0x4000) >> 16) & 2;\n" +
    5470           1 : "    n += m;\n" +
    5471           1 : "    x = (x << m) >> 14;\n" +
    5472           1 : "    m = 13 - n + (x & ~(x>>1));\n" +
    5473           1 : "  }\n" +
    5474           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5475           1 : "\n") +
    5476           1 : (
    5477           1 : "  /* Use next 2 bits to create finer-granularity bins */\n" +
    5478           1 : "  return NSMALLBINS + (m << 2) + ((sz >> (m + 6)) & 3);\n" +
    5479           1 : "}\n" +
    5480           1 : "\n" +
    5481           1 : "#define bin_index(sz) \\n" +
    5482           1 : " ((in_smallbin_range(sz)) ? smallbin_index(sz) : largebin_index(sz))\n" +
    5483           1 : "\n" +
    5484           1 : "/*\n" +
    5485           1 : "  FIRST_SORTED_BIN_SIZE is the chunk size corresponding to the\n" +
    5486           1 : "  first bin that is maintained in sorted order. This must\n" +
    5487           1 : "  be the smallest size corresponding to a given bin.\n" +
    5488           1 : "\n" +
    5489           1 : "  Normally, this should be MIN_LARGE_SIZE. But you can weaken\n" +
    5490           1 : "  best fit guarantees to sometimes speed up malloc by increasing value.\n" +
    5491           1 : "  Doing this means that malloc may choose a chunk that is\n" +
    5492           1 : "  non-best-fitting by up to the width of the bin.\n" +
    5493           1 : "\n" +
    5494           1 : "  Some useful cutoff values:\n" +
    5495           1 : "      512 - all bins sorted\n" +
    5496           1 : "     2560 - leaves bins <=     64 bytes wide unsorted\n" +
    5497           1 : "    12288 - leaves bins <=    512 bytes wide unsorted\n" +
    5498           1 : "    65536 - leaves bins <=   4096 bytes wide unsorted\n" +
    5499           1 : "   262144 - leaves bins <=  32768 bytes wide unsorted\n" +
    5500           1 : "       -1 - no bins sorted (not recommended!)\n" +
    5501           1 : "*/\n" +
    5502           1 : "\n" +
    5503           1 : "#define FIRST_SORTED_BIN_SIZE MIN_LARGE_SIZE\n" +
    5504           1 : "/* #define FIRST_SORTED_BIN_SIZE 65536 */\n" +
    5505           1 : "\n" +
    5506           1 : "/*\n" +
    5507           1 : "  Unsorted chunks\n" +
    5508           1 : "\n" +
    5509           1 : "    All remainders from chunk splits, as well as all returned chunks,\n" +
    5510           1 : "    are first placed in the \"unsorted\" bin. They are then placed\n" +
    5511           1 : "    in regular bins after malloc gives them ONE chance to be used before\n" +
    5512           1 : "    binning. So, basically, the unsorted_chunks list acts as a queue,\n" +
    5513           1 : "    with chunks being placed on it in free (and malloc_consolidate),\n" +
    5514           1 : "    and taken off (to be either used or placed in bins) in malloc.\n" +
    5515           1 : "*/\n" +
    5516           1 : "\n" +
    5517           1 : "/* The otherwise unindexable 1-bin is used to hold unsorted chunks. */\n" +
    5518           1 : "#define unsorted_chunks(M)          (bin_at(M, 1))\n" +
    5519           1 : "\n" +
    5520           1 : "/*\n" +
    5521           1 : "  Top\n" +
    5522           1 : "\n" +
    5523           1 : "    The top-most available chunk (i.e., the one bordering the end of\n" +
    5524           1 : "    available memory) is treated specially. It is never included in\n" +
    5525           1 : "    any bin, is used only if no other chunk is available, and is\n" +
    5526           1 : "    released back to the system if it is very large (see\n" +
    5527           1 : "    M_TRIM_THRESHOLD).  Because top initially\n" +
    5528           1 : "    points to its own bin with initial zero size, thus forcing\n" +
    5529           1 : "    extension on the first malloc request, we avoid having any special\n" +
    5530           1 : "    code in malloc to check whether it even exists yet. But we still\n" +
    5531           1 : "    need to do so when getting memory from system, so we make\n" +
    5532           1 : "    initial_top treat the bin as a legal but unusable chunk during the\n" +
    5533           1 : "    interval between initialization and the first call to\n" +
    5534           1 : "    sYSMALLOc. (This is somewhat delicate, since it relies on\n" +
    5535           1 : "    the 2 preceding words to be zero during this interval as well.)\n" +
    5536           1 : "*/\n" +
    5537           1 : "\n" +
    5538           1 : "/* Conveniently, the unsorted bin can be used as dummy top on first call */\n" +
    5539           1 : "#define initial_top(M)              (unsorted_chunks(M))\n" +
    5540           1 : "\n" +
    5541           1 : "/*\n" +
    5542           1 : "  Binmap\n" +
    5543           1 : "\n" +
    5544           1 : "    To help compensate for the large number of bins, a one-level index\n" +
    5545           1 : "    structure is used for bin-by-bin searching.  `binmap' is a\n" +
    5546           1 : "    bitvector recording whether bins are definitely empty so they can\n" +
    5547           1 : "    be skipped over during during traversals.  The bits are NOT always\n" +
    5548           1 : "    cleared as soon as bins are empty, but instead only\n" +
    5549           1 : "    when they are noticed to be empty during traversal in malloc.\n" +
    5550           1 : "*/\n" +
    5551           1 : "\n" +
    5552           1 : "/* Conservatively use 32 bits per map word, even if on 64bit system */\n" +
    5553           1 : "#define BINMAPSHIFT      5\n" +
    5554           1 : "#define BITSPERMAP       (1U << BINMAPSHIFT)\n" +
    5555           1 : "#define BINMAPSIZE       (NBINS / BITSPERMAP)\n" +
    5556           1 : "\n" +
    5557           1 : "#define idx2block(i)     ((i) >> BINMAPSHIFT)\n" +
    5558           1 : "#define idx2bit(i)       ((1U << ((i) & ((1U << BINMAPSHIFT)-1))))\n" +
    5559           1 : "\n" +
    5560           1 : "#define mark_bin(m,i)    ((m)->binmap[idx2block(i)] |=  idx2bit(i))\n" +
    5561           1 : "#define unmark_bin(m,i)  ((m)->binmap[idx2block(i)] &= ~(idx2bit(i)))\n" +
    5562           1 : "#define get_binmap(m,i)  ((m)->binmap[idx2block(i)] &   idx2bit(i))\n" +
    5563           1 : "\n" +
    5564           1 : "/*\n" +
    5565           1 : "  Fastbins\n" +
    5566           1 : "\n" +
    5567           1 : "    An array of lists holding recently freed small chunks.  Fastbins\n" +
    5568           1 : "    are not doubly linked.  It is faster to single-link them, and\n" +
    5569           1 : "    since chunks are never removed from the middles of these lists,\n" +
    5570           1 : "    double linking is not necessary. Also, unlike regular bins, they\n" +
    5571           1 : "    are not even processed in FIFO order (they use faster LIFO) since\n" +
    5572           1 : "    ordering doesn't much matter in the transient contexts in which\n" +
    5573           1 : "    fastbins are normally used.\n" +
    5574           1 : "\n" +
    5575           1 : "    Chunks in fastbins keep their inuse bit set, so they cannot\n" +
    5576           1 : "    be consolidated with other free chunks. malloc_consolidate\n" +
    5577           1 : "    releases all chunks in fastbins and consolidates them with\n" +
    5578           1 : "    other free chunks.\n" +
    5579           1 : "*/\n" +
    5580           1 : "\n" +
    5581           1 : "typedef struct malloc_chunk* mfastbinptr;\n" +
    5582           1 : "\n" +
    5583           1 : "/* offset 2 to use otherwise unindexable first 2 bins */\n" +
    5584           1 : "#define fastbin_index(sz)        ((((unsigned int)(sz)) >> 3) - 2)\n" +
    5585           1 : "\n" +
    5586           1 : "/* The maximum fastbin request size we support */\n" +
    5587           1 : "#define MAX_FAST_SIZE     80\n" +
    5588           1 : "\n" +
    5589           1 : "#define NFASTBINS  (fastbin_index(request2size(MAX_FAST_SIZE))+1)\n" +
    5590           1 : "\n" +
    5591           1 : "/*\n" +
    5592           1 : "  FASTBIN_CONSOLIDATION_THRESHOLD is the size of a chunk in free()\n" +
    5593           1 : "  that triggers automatic consolidation of possibly-surrounding\n" +
    5594           1 : "  fastbin chunks. This is a heuristic, so the exact value should not\n" +
    5595           1 : "  matter too much. It is defined at half the default trim threshold as a\n" +
    5596           1 : "  compromise heuristic to only attempt consolidation if it is likely\n" +
    5597           1 : "  to lead to trimming. However, it is not dynamically tunable, since\n" +
    5598           1 : "  consolidation reduces fragmentation surrounding loarge chunks even\n" +
    5599           1 : "  if trimming is not used.\n" +
    5600           1 : "*/\n" +
    5601           1 : "\n" +
    5602           1 : "#define FASTBIN_CONSOLIDATION_THRESHOLD  \\n" +
    5603           1 : "  ((unsigned long)(DEFAULT_TRIM_THRESHOLD) >> 1)\n" +
    5604           1 : "\n" +
    5605           1 : "/*\n" +
    5606           1 : "  Since the lowest 2 bits in max_fast don't matter in size comparisons,\n" +
    5607           1 : "  they are used as flags.\n" +
    5608           1 : "*/\n" +
    5609           1 : "\n" +
    5610           1 : "/*\n" +
    5611           1 : "  ANYCHUNKS_BIT held in max_fast indicates that there may be any\n" +
    5612           1 : "  freed chunks at all. It is set true when entering a chunk into any\n" +
    5613           1 : "  bin.\n" +
    5614           1 : "*/\n" +
    5615           1 : "\n" +
    5616           1 : "#define ANYCHUNKS_BIT        (1U)\n" +
    5617           1 : "\n" +
    5618           1 : "#define have_anychunks(M)     (((M)->max_fast &  ANYCHUNKS_BIT))\n" +
    5619           1 : "#define set_anychunks(M)      ((M)->max_fast |=  ANYCHUNKS_BIT)\n" +
    5620           1 : "#define clear_anychunks(M)    ((M)->max_fast &= ~ANYCHUNKS_BIT)\n" +
    5621           1 : "\n" +
    5622           1 : "/*\n" +
    5623           1 : "  FASTCHUNKS_BIT held in max_fast indicates that there are probably\n" +
    5624           1 : "  some fastbin chunks. It is set true on entering a chunk into any\n" +
    5625           1 : "  fastbin, and cleared only in malloc_consolidate.\n" +
    5626           1 : "*/\n" +
    5627           1 : "\n") +
    5628           1 : (
    5629           1 : "#define FASTCHUNKS_BIT        (2U)\n" +
    5630           1 : "\n" +
    5631           1 : "#define have_fastchunks(M)   (((M)->max_fast &  FASTCHUNKS_BIT))\n" +
    5632           1 : "#define set_fastchunks(M)    ((M)->max_fast |=  (FASTCHUNKS_BIT|ANYCHUNKS_BIT))\n" +
    5633           1 : "#define clear_fastchunks(M)  ((M)->max_fast &= ~(FASTCHUNKS_BIT))\n" +
    5634           1 : "\n" +
    5635           1 : "/*\n" +
    5636           1 : "   Set value of max_fast.\n" +
    5637           1 : "   Use impossibly small value if 0.\n" +
    5638           1 : "*/\n" +
    5639           1 : "\n" +
    5640           1 : "#define set_max_fast(M, s) \\n" +
    5641           1 : "  (M)->max_fast = (((s) == 0)? SMALLBIN_WIDTH: request2size(s)) | \\n" +
    5642           1 : "  ((M)->max_fast &  (FASTCHUNKS_BIT|ANYCHUNKS_BIT))\n" +
    5643           1 : "\n" +
    5644           1 : "#define get_max_fast(M) \\n" +
    5645           1 : "  ((M)->max_fast & ~(FASTCHUNKS_BIT | ANYCHUNKS_BIT))\n" +
    5646           1 : "\n" +
    5647           1 : "\n" +
    5648           1 : "/*\n" +
    5649           1 : "  morecore_properties is a status word holding dynamically discovered\n" +
    5650           1 : "  or controlled properties of the morecore function\n" +
    5651           1 : "*/\n" +
    5652           1 : "\n" +
    5653           1 : "#define MORECORE_CONTIGUOUS_BIT  (1U)\n" +
    5654           1 : "\n" +
    5655           1 : "#define contiguous(M) \\n" +
    5656           1 : "        (((M)->morecore_properties &  MORECORE_CONTIGUOUS_BIT))\n" +
    5657           1 : "#define noncontiguous(M) \\n" +
    5658           1 : "        (((M)->morecore_properties &  MORECORE_CONTIGUOUS_BIT) == 0)\n" +
    5659           1 : "#define set_contiguous(M) \\n" +
    5660           1 : "        ((M)->morecore_properties |=  MORECORE_CONTIGUOUS_BIT)\n" +
    5661           1 : "#define set_noncontiguous(M) \\n" +
    5662           1 : "        ((M)->morecore_properties &= ~MORECORE_CONTIGUOUS_BIT)\n" +
    5663           1 : "\n" +
    5664           1 : "\n" +
    5665           1 : "/*\n" +
    5666           1 : "   ----------- Internal state representation and initialization -----------\n" +
    5667           1 : "*/\n" +
    5668           1 : "\n" +
    5669           1 : "struct malloc_state {\n" +
    5670           1 : "\n" +
    5671           1 : "  /* The maximum chunk size to be eligible for fastbin */\n" +
    5672           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  max_fast;   /* low 2 bits used as flags */\n" +
    5673           1 : "\n" +
    5674           1 : "  /* Fastbins */\n" +
    5675           1 : "  mfastbinptr      fastbins[NFASTBINS];\n" +
    5676           1 : "\n" +
    5677           1 : "  /* Base of the topmost chunk -- not otherwise kept in a bin */\n" +
    5678           1 : "  mchunkptr        top;\n" +
    5679           1 : "\n" +
    5680           1 : "  /* The remainder from the most recent split of a small request */\n" +
    5681           1 : "  mchunkptr        last_remainder;\n" +
    5682           1 : "\n" +
    5683           1 : "  /* Normal bins packed as described above */\n" +
    5684           1 : "  mchunkptr        bins[NBINS * 2];\n" +
    5685           1 : "\n" +
    5686           1 : "  /* Bitmap of bins. Trailing zero map handles cases of largest binned size */\n" +
    5687           1 : "  unsigned int     binmap[BINMAPSIZE+1];\n" +
    5688           1 : "\n" +
    5689           1 : "  /* Tunable parameters */\n" +
    5690           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T     trim_threshold;\n" +
    5691           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  top_pad;\n" +
    5692           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  mmap_threshold;\n" +
    5693           1 : "\n" +
    5694           1 : "  /* Memory map support */\n" +
    5695           1 : "  int              n_mmaps;\n" +
    5696           1 : "  int              n_mmaps_max;\n" +
    5697           1 : "  int              max_n_mmaps;\n" +
    5698           1 : "\n" +
    5699           1 : "  /* Cache malloc_getpagesize */\n" +
    5700           1 : "  unsigned int     pagesize;\n" +
    5701           1 : "\n" +
    5702           1 : "  /* Track properties of MORECORE */\n" +
    5703           1 : "  unsigned int     morecore_properties;\n" +
    5704           1 : "\n" +
    5705           1 : "  /* Statistics */\n" +
    5706           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  mmapped_mem;\n" +
    5707           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  sbrked_mem;\n" +
    5708           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  max_sbrked_mem;\n" +
    5709           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  max_mmapped_mem;\n" +
    5710           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  max_total_mem;\n" +
    5711           1 : "};\n" +
    5712           1 : "\n" +
    5713           1 : "typedef struct malloc_state *mstate;\n" +
    5714           1 : "\n" +
    5715           1 : "/*\n" +
    5716           1 : "   There is exactly one instance of this struct in this malloc.\n" +
    5717           1 : "   If you are adapting this malloc in a way that does NOT use a static\n" +
    5718           1 : "   malloc_state, you MUST explicitly zero-fill it before using. This\n" +
    5719           1 : "   malloc relies on the property that malloc_state is initialized to\n" +
    5720           1 : "   all zeroes (as is true of C statics).\n" +
    5721           1 : "*/\n" +
    5722           1 : "\n" +
    5723           1 : "static struct malloc_state av_;  /* never directly referenced */\n" +
    5724           1 : "\n" +
    5725           1 : "/*\n" +
    5726           1 : "   All uses of av_ are via get_malloc_state().\n" +
    5727           1 : "   At most one \"call\" to get_malloc_state is made per invocation of\n" +
    5728           1 : "   the public versions of malloc and free, but other routines\n" +
    5729           1 : "   that in turn invoke malloc and/or free may call more than once.\n" +
    5730           1 : "   Also, it is called in check* routines if DEBUG is set.\n" +
    5731           1 : "*/\n" +
    5732           1 : "\n" +
    5733           1 : "#define get_malloc_state() (&(av_))\n" +
    5734           1 : "\n" +
    5735           1 : "/*\n" +
    5736           1 : "  Initialize a malloc_state struct.\n" +
    5737           1 : "\n" +
    5738           1 : "  This is called only from within malloc_consolidate, which needs\n" +
    5739           1 : "  be called in the same contexts anyway.  It is never called directly\n" +
    5740           1 : "  outside of malloc_consolidate because some optimizing compilers try\n" +
    5741           1 : "  to inline it at all call points, which turns out not to be an\n" +
    5742           1 : "  optimization at all. (Inlining it in malloc_consolidate is fine though.)\n" +
    5743           1 : "*/\n" +
    5744           1 : "\n" +
    5745           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    5746           1 : "static void malloc_init_state(mstate av)\n" +
    5747           1 : "#else\n" +
    5748           1 : "static void malloc_init_state(av) mstate av;\n" +
    5749           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5750           1 : "{\n" +
    5751           1 : "  int     i;\n" +
    5752           1 : "  mbinptr bin;\n" +
    5753           1 : "\n" +
    5754           1 : "  /* Establish circular links for normal bins */\n" +
    5755           1 : "  for (i = 1; i < NBINS; ++i) {\n" +
    5756           1 : "    bin = bin_at(av,i);\n" +
    5757           1 : "    bin->fd = bin->bk = bin;\n" +
    5758           1 : "  }\n" +
    5759           1 : "\n" +
    5760           1 : "  av->top_pad        = DEFAULT_TOP_PAD;\n" +
    5761           1 : "  av->n_mmaps_max    = DEFAULT_MMAP_MAX;\n" +
    5762           1 : "  av->mmap_threshold = DEFAULT_MMAP_THRESHOLD;\n" +
    5763           1 : "  av->trim_threshold = DEFAULT_TRIM_THRESHOLD;\n" +
    5764           1 : "\n" +
    5765           1 : "#if MORECORE_CONTIGUOUS\n" +
    5766           1 : "  set_contiguous(av);\n" +
    5767           1 : "#else\n" +
    5768           1 : "  set_noncontiguous(av);\n" +
    5769           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5770           1 : "\n" +
    5771           1 : "\n" +
    5772           1 : "  set_max_fast(av, DEFAULT_MXFAST);\n" +
    5773           1 : "\n" +
    5774           1 : "  av->top            = initial_top(av);\n" +
    5775           1 : "  av->pagesize       = malloc_getpagesize;\n" +
    5776           1 : "}\n" +
    5777           1 : "\n" +
    5778           1 : "/*\n" +
    5779           1 : "   Other internal utilities operating on mstates\n" +
    5780           1 : "*/\n" +
    5781           1 : "\n") +
    5782           1 : (
    5783           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    5784           1 : "static Void_t*  sYSMALLOc(INTERNAL_SIZE_T, mstate);\n" +
    5785           1 : "#ifndef MORECORE_CANNOT_TRIM\n" +
    5786           1 : "static int      sYSTRIm(size_t, mstate);\n" +
    5787           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5788           1 : "static void     malloc_consolidate(mstate);\n" +
    5789           1 : "static Void_t** iALLOc(size_t, size_t*, int, Void_t**);\n" +
    5790           1 : "#else\n" +
    5791           1 : "static Void_t*  sYSMALLOc();\n" +
    5792           1 : "static int      sYSTRIm();\n" +
    5793           1 : "static void     malloc_consolidate();\n" +
    5794           1 : "static Void_t** iALLOc();\n" +
    5795           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5796           1 : "\n" +
    5797           1 : "/*\n" +
    5798           1 : "  Debugging support\n" +
    5799           1 : "\n" +
    5800           1 : "  These routines make a number of assertions about the states\n" +
    5801           1 : "  of data structures that should be true at all times. If any\n" +
    5802           1 : "  are not true, it's very likely that a user program has somehow\n" +
    5803           1 : "  trashed memory. (It's also possible that there is a coding error\n" +
    5804           1 : "  in malloc. In which case, please report it!)\n" +
    5805           1 : "*/\n" +
    5806           1 : "\n" +
    5807           1 : "#if ! DEBUG\n" +
    5808           1 : "\n" +
    5809           1 : "#define check_chunk(P)\n" +
    5810           1 : "#define check_free_chunk(P)\n" +
    5811           1 : "#define check_inuse_chunk(P)\n" +
    5812           1 : "#define check_remalloced_chunk(P,N)\n" +
    5813           1 : "#define check_malloced_chunk(P,N)\n" +
    5814           1 : "#define check_malloc_state()\n" +
    5815           1 : "\n" +
    5816           1 : "#else\n" +
    5817           1 : "#define check_chunk(P)              do_check_chunk(P)\n" +
    5818           1 : "#define check_free_chunk(P)         do_check_free_chunk(P)\n" +
    5819           1 : "#define check_inuse_chunk(P)        do_check_inuse_chunk(P)\n" +
    5820           1 : "#define check_remalloced_chunk(P,N) do_check_remalloced_chunk(P,N)\n" +
    5821           1 : "#define check_malloced_chunk(P,N)   do_check_malloced_chunk(P,N)\n" +
    5822           1 : "#define check_malloc_state()        do_check_malloc_state()\n" +
    5823           1 : "\n" +
    5824           1 : "/*\n" +
    5825           1 : "  Properties of all chunks\n" +
    5826           1 : "*/\n" +
    5827           1 : "\n" +
    5828           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    5829           1 : "static void do_check_chunk(mchunkptr p)\n" +
    5830           1 : "#else\n" +
    5831           1 : "static void do_check_chunk(p) mchunkptr p;\n" +
    5832           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5833           1 : "{\n" +
    5834           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    5835           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T  sz = chunksize(p);\n" +
    5836           1 : "  /* min and max possible addresses assuming contiguous allocation */\n" +
    5837           1 : "  char* max_address = (char*)(av->top) + chunksize(av->top);\n" +
    5838           1 : "  char* min_address = max_address - av->sbrked_mem;\n" +
    5839           1 : "\n" +
    5840           1 : "  if (!chunk_is_mmapped(p)) {\n" +
    5841           1 : "\n" +
    5842           1 : "    /* Has legal address ... */\n" +
    5843           1 : "    if (p != av->top) {\n" +
    5844           1 : "      if (contiguous(av)) {\n" +
    5845           1 : "        assert(((char*)p) >= min_address);\n" +
    5846           1 : "        assert(((char*)p + sz) <= ((char*)(av->top)));\n" +
    5847           1 : "      }\n" +
    5848           1 : "    }\n" +
    5849           1 : "    else {\n" +
    5850           1 : "      /* top size is always at least MINSIZE */\n" +
    5851           1 : "      assert((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(sz) >= MINSIZE);\n" +
    5852           1 : "      /* top predecessor always marked inuse */\n" +
    5853           1 : "      assert(prev_inuse(p));\n" +
    5854           1 : "    }\n" +
    5855           1 : "\n" +
    5856           1 : "  }\n" +
    5857           1 : "  else {\n" +
    5858           1 : "#if HAVE_MMAP\n" +
    5859           1 : "    /* address is outside main heap  */\n" +
    5860           1 : "    if (contiguous(av) && av->top != initial_top(av)) {\n" +
    5861           1 : "      assert(((char*)p) < min_address || ((char*)p) > max_address);\n" +
    5862           1 : "    }\n" +
    5863           1 : "    /* chunk is page-aligned */\n" +
    5864           1 : "    assert(((p->prev_size + sz) & (av->pagesize-1)) == 0);\n" +
    5865           1 : "    /* mem is aligned */\n" +
    5866           1 : "    assert(aligned_OK(chunk2mem(p)));\n" +
    5867           1 : "#else\n" +
    5868           1 : "    /* force an appropriate assert violation if debug set */\n" +
    5869           1 : "    assert(!chunk_is_mmapped(p));\n" +
    5870           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5871           1 : "  }\n" +
    5872           1 : "}\n" +
    5873           1 : "\n" +
    5874           1 : "/*\n" +
    5875           1 : "  Properties of free chunks\n" +
    5876           1 : "*/\n" +
    5877           1 : "\n" +
    5878           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    5879           1 : "static void do_check_free_chunk(mchunkptr p)\n" +
    5880           1 : "#else\n" +
    5881           1 : "static void do_check_free_chunk(p) mchunkptr p;\n" +
    5882           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5883           1 : "{\n" +
    5884           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    5885           1 : "\n" +
    5886           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T sz = p->size & ~PREV_INUSE;\n" +
    5887           1 : "  mchunkptr next = chunk_at_offset(p, sz);\n" +
    5888           1 : "\n" +
    5889           1 : "  do_check_chunk(p);\n" +
    5890           1 : "\n" +
    5891           1 : "  /* Chunk must claim to be free ... */\n" +
    5892           1 : "  assert(!inuse(p));\n" +
    5893           1 : "  assert (!chunk_is_mmapped(p));\n" +
    5894           1 : "\n" +
    5895           1 : "  /* Unless a special marker, must have OK fields */\n" +
    5896           1 : "  if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(sz) >= MINSIZE)\n" +
    5897           1 : "  {\n" +
    5898           1 : "    assert((sz & MALLOC_ALIGN_MASK) == 0);\n" +
    5899           1 : "    assert(aligned_OK(chunk2mem(p)));\n" +
    5900           1 : "    /* ... matching footer field */\n" +
    5901           1 : "    assert(next->prev_size == sz);\n" +
    5902           1 : "    /* ... and is fully consolidated */\n" +
    5903           1 : "    assert(prev_inuse(p));\n" +
    5904           1 : "    assert (next == av->top || inuse(next));\n" +
    5905           1 : "\n" +
    5906           1 : "    /* ... and has minimally sane links */\n" +
    5907           1 : "    assert(p->fd->bk == p);\n" +
    5908           1 : "    assert(p->bk->fd == p);\n" +
    5909           1 : "  }\n" +
    5910           1 : "  else /* markers are always of size SIZE_SZ */\n" +
    5911           1 : "    assert(sz == SIZE_SZ);\n" +
    5912           1 : "}\n" +
    5913           1 : "\n" +
    5914           1 : "/*\n" +
    5915           1 : "  Properties of inuse chunks\n" +
    5916           1 : "*/\n" +
    5917           1 : "\n" +
    5918           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    5919           1 : "static void do_check_inuse_chunk(mchunkptr p)\n" +
    5920           1 : "#else\n" +
    5921           1 : "static void do_check_inuse_chunk(p) mchunkptr p;\n" +
    5922           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5923           1 : "{\n" +
    5924           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    5925           1 : "  mchunkptr next;\n" +
    5926           1 : "  do_check_chunk(p);\n" +
    5927           1 : "\n" +
    5928           1 : "  if (chunk_is_mmapped(p))\n" +
    5929           1 : "    return; /* mmapped chunks have no next/prev */\n" +
    5930           1 : "\n" +
    5931           1 : "  /* Check whether it claims to be in use ... */\n" +
    5932           1 : "  assert(inuse(p));\n" +
    5933           1 : "\n") +
    5934           1 : (
    5935           1 : "  next = next_chunk(p);\n" +
    5936           1 : "\n" +
    5937           1 : "  /* ... and is surrounded by OK chunks.\n" +
    5938           1 : "    Since more things can be checked with free chunks than inuse ones,\n" +
    5939           1 : "    if an inuse chunk borders them and debug is on, it's worth doing them.\n" +
    5940           1 : "  */\n" +
    5941           1 : "  if (!prev_inuse(p))  {\n" +
    5942           1 : "    /* Note that we cannot even look at prev unless it is not inuse */\n" +
    5943           1 : "    mchunkptr prv = prev_chunk(p);\n" +
    5944           1 : "    assert(next_chunk(prv) == p);\n" +
    5945           1 : "    do_check_free_chunk(prv);\n" +
    5946           1 : "  }\n" +
    5947           1 : "\n" +
    5948           1 : "  if (next == av->top) {\n" +
    5949           1 : "    assert(prev_inuse(next));\n" +
    5950           1 : "    assert(chunksize(next) >= MINSIZE);\n" +
    5951           1 : "  }\n" +
    5952           1 : "  else if (!inuse(next))\n" +
    5953           1 : "    do_check_free_chunk(next);\n" +
    5954           1 : "}\n" +
    5955           1 : "\n" +
    5956           1 : "/*\n" +
    5957           1 : "  Properties of chunks recycled from fastbins\n" +
    5958           1 : "*/\n" +
    5959           1 : "\n" +
    5960           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    5961           1 : "static void do_check_remalloced_chunk(mchunkptr p, INTERNAL_SIZE_T s)\n" +
    5962           1 : "#else\n" +
    5963           1 : "static void do_check_remalloced_chunk(p, s) mchunkptr p; INTERNAL_SIZE_T s;\n" +
    5964           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5965           1 : "{\n" +
    5966           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T sz = p->size & ~PREV_INUSE;\n" +
    5967           1 : "\n" +
    5968           1 : "  do_check_inuse_chunk(p);\n" +
    5969           1 : "\n" +
    5970           1 : "  /* Legal size ... */\n" +
    5971           1 : "  assert((sz & MALLOC_ALIGN_MASK) == 0);\n" +
    5972           1 : "  assert((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(sz) >= MINSIZE);\n" +
    5973           1 : "  /* ... and alignment */\n" +
    5974           1 : "  assert(aligned_OK(chunk2mem(p)));\n" +
    5975           1 : "  /* chunk is less than MINSIZE more than request */\n" +
    5976           1 : "  assert((long)(sz) - (long)(s) >= 0);\n" +
    5977           1 : "  assert((long)(sz) - (long)(s + MINSIZE) < 0);\n" +
    5978           1 : "}\n" +
    5979           1 : "\n" +
    5980           1 : "/*\n" +
    5981           1 : "  Properties of nonrecycled chunks at the point they are malloced\n" +
    5982           1 : "*/\n" +
    5983           1 : "\n" +
    5984           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    5985           1 : "static void do_check_malloced_chunk(mchunkptr p, INTERNAL_SIZE_T s)\n" +
    5986           1 : "#else\n" +
    5987           1 : "static void do_check_malloced_chunk(p, s) mchunkptr p; INTERNAL_SIZE_T s;\n" +
    5988           1 : "#endif\n" +
    5989           1 : "{\n" +
    5990           1 : "  /* same as recycled case ... */\n" +
    5991           1 : "  do_check_remalloced_chunk(p, s);\n" +
    5992           1 : "\n" +
    5993           1 : "  /*\n" +
    5994           1 : "    ... plus,  must obey implementation invariant that prev_inuse is\n" +
    5995           1 : "    always true of any allocated chunk; i.e., that each allocated\n" +
    5996           1 : "    chunk borders either a previously allocated and still in-use\n" +
    5997           1 : "    chunk, or the base of its memory arena. This is ensured\n" +
    5998           1 : "    by making all allocations from the the `lowest' part of any found\n" +
    5999           1 : "    chunk.  This does not necessarily hold however for chunks\n" +
    6000           1 : "    recycled via fastbins.\n" +
    6001           1 : "  */\n" +
    6002           1 : "\n" +
    6003           1 : "  assert(prev_inuse(p));\n" +
    6004           1 : "}\n" +
    6005           1 : "\n" +
    6006           1 : "\n" +
    6007           1 : "/*\n" +
    6008           1 : "  Properties of malloc_state.\n" +
    6009           1 : "\n" +
    6010           1 : "  This may be useful for debugging malloc, as well as detecting user\n" +
    6011           1 : "  programmer errors that somehow write into malloc_state.\n" +
    6012           1 : "\n" +
    6013           1 : "  If you are extending or experimenting with this malloc, you can\n" +
    6014           1 : "  probably figure out how to hack this routine to print out or\n" +
    6015           1 : "  display chunk addresses, sizes, bins, and other instrumentation.\n" +
    6016           1 : "*/\n" +
    6017           1 : "\n" +
    6018           1 : "static void do_check_malloc_state()\n" +
    6019           1 : "{\n" +
    6020           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    6021           1 : "  unsigned int i;\n" +
    6022           1 : "  mchunkptr p;\n" +
    6023           1 : "  mchunkptr q;\n" +
    6024           1 : "  mbinptr b;\n" +
    6025           1 : "  unsigned int binbit;\n" +
    6026           1 : "  int empty;\n" +
    6027           1 : "  unsigned int idx;\n" +
    6028           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T size;\n" +
    6029           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T  total = 0;\n" +
    6030           1 : "  int max_fast_bin;\n" +
    6031           1 : "\n" +
    6032           1 : "  /* internal size_t must be no wider than pointer type */\n" +
    6033           1 : "  assert(sizeof(INTERNAL_SIZE_T) <= sizeof(char*));\n" +
    6034           1 : "\n" +
    6035           1 : "  /* alignment is a power of 2 */\n" +
    6036           1 : "  assert((MALLOC_ALIGNMENT & (MALLOC_ALIGNMENT-1)) == 0);\n" +
    6037           1 : "\n" +
    6038           1 : "  /* cannot run remaining checks until fully initialized */\n" +
    6039           1 : "  if (av->top == 0 || av->top == initial_top(av))\n" +
    6040           1 : "    return;\n" +
    6041           1 : "\n" +
    6042           1 : "  /* pagesize is a power of 2 */\n" +
    6043           1 : "  assert((av->pagesize & (av->pagesize-1)) == 0);\n" +
    6044           1 : "\n" +
    6045           1 : "  /* properties of fastbins */\n" +
    6046           1 : "\n" +
    6047           1 : "  /* max_fast is in allowed range */\n" +
    6048           1 : "  assert(get_max_fast(av) <= request2size(MAX_FAST_SIZE));\n" +
    6049           1 : "\n" +
    6050           1 : "  max_fast_bin = fastbin_index(av->max_fast);\n" +
    6051           1 : "\n" +
    6052           1 : "  for (i = 0; i < NFASTBINS; ++i) {\n" +
    6053           1 : "    p = av->fastbins[i];\n" +
    6054           1 : "\n" +
    6055           1 : "    /* all bins past max_fast are empty */\n" +
    6056           1 : "    if (i > max_fast_bin)\n" +
    6057           1 : "      assert(p == 0);\n" +
    6058           1 : "\n" +
    6059           1 : "    while (p != 0) {\n" +
    6060           1 : "      /* each chunk claims to be inuse */\n" +
    6061           1 : "      do_check_inuse_chunk(p);\n" +
    6062           1 : "      total += chunksize(p);\n" +
    6063           1 : "      /* chunk belongs in this bin */\n" +
    6064           1 : "      assert(fastbin_index(chunksize(p)) == i);\n" +
    6065           1 : "      p = p->fd;\n" +
    6066           1 : "    }\n" +
    6067           1 : "  }\n" +
    6068           1 : "\n" +
    6069           1 : "  if (total != 0)\n" +
    6070           1 : "    assert(have_fastchunks(av));\n" +
    6071           1 : "  else if (!have_fastchunks(av))\n" +
    6072           1 : "    assert(total == 0);\n" +
    6073           1 : "\n" +
    6074           1 : "  /* check normal bins */\n" +
    6075           1 : "  for (i = 1; i < NBINS; ++i) {\n" +
    6076           1 : "    b = bin_at(av,i);\n" +
    6077           1 : "\n" +
    6078           1 : "    /* binmap is accurate (except for bin 1 == unsorted_chunks) */\n" +
    6079           1 : "    if (i >= 2) {\n" +
    6080           1 : "      binbit = get_binmap(av,i);\n" +
    6081           1 : "      empty = last(b) == b;\n" +
    6082           1 : "      if (!binbit)\n" +
    6083           1 : "        assert(empty);\n" +
    6084           1 : "      else if (!empty)\n" +
    6085           1 : "        assert(binbit);\n" +
    6086           1 : "    }\n" +
    6087           1 : "\n") +
    6088           1 : (
    6089           1 : "    for (p = last(b); p != b; p = p->bk) {\n" +
    6090           1 : "      /* each chunk claims to be free */\n" +
    6091           1 : "      do_check_free_chunk(p);\n" +
    6092           1 : "      size = chunksize(p);\n" +
    6093           1 : "      total += size;\n" +
    6094           1 : "      if (i >= 2) {\n" +
    6095           1 : "        /* chunk belongs in bin */\n" +
    6096           1 : "        idx = bin_index(size);\n" +
    6097           1 : "        assert(idx == i);\n" +
    6098           1 : "        /* lists are sorted */\n" +
    6099           1 : "        if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T) size >= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(FIRST_SORTED_BIN_SIZE)) {\n" +
    6100           1 : "          assert(p->bk == b ||\n" +
    6101           1 : "                 (CHUNK_SIZE_T)chunksize(p->bk) >=\n" +
    6102           1 : "                 (CHUNK_SIZE_T)chunksize(p));\n" +
    6103           1 : "        }\n" +
    6104           1 : "      }\n" +
    6105           1 : "      /* chunk is followed by a legal chain of inuse chunks */\n" +
    6106           1 : "      for (q = next_chunk(p);\n" +
    6107           1 : "           (q != av->top && inuse(q) &&\n" +
    6108           1 : "             (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(chunksize(q)) >= MINSIZE);\n" +
    6109           1 : "           q = next_chunk(q))\n" +
    6110           1 : "        do_check_inuse_chunk(q);\n" +
    6111           1 : "    }\n" +
    6112           1 : "  }\n" +
    6113           1 : "\n" +
    6114           1 : "  /* top chunk is OK */\n" +
    6115           1 : "  check_chunk(av->top);\n" +
    6116           1 : "\n" +
    6117           1 : "  /* sanity checks for statistics */\n" +
    6118           1 : "\n" +
    6119           1 : "  assert(total <= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_total_mem));\n" +
    6120           1 : "  assert(av->n_mmaps >= 0);\n" +
    6121           1 : "  assert(av->n_mmaps <= av->max_n_mmaps);\n" +
    6122           1 : "\n" +
    6123           1 : "  assert((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->sbrked_mem) <=\n" +
    6124           1 : "         (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_sbrked_mem));\n" +
    6125           1 : "\n" +
    6126           1 : "  assert((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->mmapped_mem) <=\n" +
    6127           1 : "         (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_mmapped_mem));\n" +
    6128           1 : "\n" +
    6129           1 : "  assert((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_total_mem) >=\n" +
    6130           1 : "         (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->mmapped_mem) + (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->sbrked_mem));\n" +
    6131           1 : "}\n" +
    6132           1 : "#endif\n" +
    6133           1 : "\n" +
    6134           1 : "\n" +
    6135           1 : "/* ----------- Routines dealing with system allocation -------------- */\n" +
    6136           1 : "\n" +
    6137           1 : "/*\n" +
    6138           1 : "  sysmalloc handles malloc cases requiring more memory from the system.\n" +
    6139           1 : "  On entry, it is assumed that av->top does not have enough\n" +
    6140           1 : "  space to service request for nb bytes, thus requiring that av->top\n" +
    6141           1 : "  be extended or replaced.\n" +
    6142           1 : "*/\n" +
    6143           1 : "\n" +
    6144           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    6145           1 : "static Void_t* sYSMALLOc(INTERNAL_SIZE_T nb, mstate av)\n" +
    6146           1 : "#else\n" +
    6147           1 : "static Void_t* sYSMALLOc(nb, av) INTERNAL_SIZE_T nb; mstate av;\n" +
    6148           1 : "#endif\n" +
    6149           1 : "{\n" +
    6150           1 : "  mchunkptr       old_top;        /* incoming value of av->top */\n" +
    6151           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T old_size;       /* its size */\n" +
    6152           1 : "  char*           old_end;        /* its end address */\n" +
    6153           1 : "\n" +
    6154           1 : "  long            size;           /* arg to first MORECORE or mmap call */\n" +
    6155           1 : "  char*           brk;            /* return value from MORECORE */\n" +
    6156           1 : "\n" +
    6157           1 : "  long            correction;     /* arg to 2nd MORECORE call */\n" +
    6158           1 : "  char*           snd_brk;        /* 2nd return val */\n" +
    6159           1 : "\n" +
    6160           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T front_misalign; /* unusable bytes at front of new space */\n" +
    6161           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T end_misalign;   /* partial page left at end of new space */\n" +
    6162           1 : "  char*           aligned_brk;    /* aligned offset into brk */\n" +
    6163           1 : "\n" +
    6164           1 : "  mchunkptr       p;              /* the allocated/returned chunk */\n" +
    6165           1 : "  mchunkptr       remainder;      /* remainder from allocation */\n" +
    6166           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T    remainder_size; /* its size */\n" +
    6167           1 : "\n" +
    6168           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T    sum;            /* for updating stats */\n" +
    6169           1 : "\n" +
    6170           1 : "  size_t          pagemask  = av->pagesize - 1;\n" +
    6171           1 : "\n" +
    6172           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6173           1 : "    If there is space available in fastbins, consolidate and retry\n" +
    6174           1 : "    malloc from scratch rather than getting memory from system.  This\n" +
    6175           1 : "    can occur only if nb is in smallbin range so we didn't consolidate\n" +
    6176           1 : "    upon entry to malloc. It is much easier to handle this case here\n" +
    6177           1 : "    than in malloc proper.\n" +
    6178           1 : "  */\n" +
    6179           1 : "\n" +
    6180           1 : "  if (have_fastchunks(av)) {\n" +
    6181           1 : "    assert(in_smallbin_range(nb));\n" +
    6182           1 : "    malloc_consolidate(av);\n" +
    6183           1 : "    return mALLOc(nb - MALLOC_ALIGN_MASK);\n" +
    6184           1 : "  }\n" +
    6185           1 : "\n" +
    6186           1 : "\n" +
    6187           1 : "#if HAVE_MMAP\n" +
    6188           1 : "\n" +
    6189           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6190           1 : "    If have mmap, and the request size meets the mmap threshold, and\n" +
    6191           1 : "    the system supports mmap, and there are few enough currently\n" +
    6192           1 : "    allocated mmapped regions, try to directly map this request\n" +
    6193           1 : "    rather than expanding top.\n" +
    6194           1 : "  */\n" +
    6195           1 : "\n" +
    6196           1 : "  if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb) >= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->mmap_threshold) &&\n" +
    6197           1 : "      (av->n_mmaps < av->n_mmaps_max)) {\n" +
    6198           1 : "\n" +
    6199           1 : "    char* mm;             /* return value from mmap call*/\n" +
    6200           1 : "\n" +
    6201           1 : "    /*\n" +
    6202           1 : "      Round up size to nearest page.  For mmapped chunks, the overhead\n" +
    6203           1 : "      is one SIZE_SZ unit larger than for normal chunks, because there\n" +
    6204           1 : "      is no following chunk whose prev_size field could be used.\n" +
    6205           1 : "    */\n" +
    6206           1 : "    size = (nb + SIZE_SZ + MALLOC_ALIGN_MASK + pagemask) & ~pagemask;\n" +
    6207           1 : "\n" +
    6208           1 : "    /* Don't try if size wraps around 0 */\n" +
    6209           1 : "    if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) > (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb)) {\n" +
    6210           1 : "\n" +
    6211           1 : "      mm = (char*)(MMAP(0, size, PROT_READ|PROT_WRITE, MAP_PRIVATE));\n" +
    6212           1 : "\n" +
    6213           1 : "      if (mm != (char*)(MORECORE_FAILURE)) {\n" +
    6214           1 : "\n" +
    6215           1 : "        /*\n" +
    6216           1 : "          The offset to the start of the mmapped region is stored\n" +
    6217           1 : "          in the prev_size field of the chunk. This allows us to adjust\n" +
    6218           1 : "          returned start address to meet alignment requirements here\n" +
    6219           1 : "          and in memalign(), and still be able to compute proper\n" +
    6220           1 : "          address argument for later munmap in free() and realloc().\n" +
    6221           1 : "        */\n" +
    6222           1 : "\n" +
    6223           1 : "        front_misalign = (INTERNAL_SIZE_T)chunk2mem(mm) & MALLOC_ALIGN_MASK;\n" +
    6224           1 : "        if (front_misalign > 0) {\n" +
    6225           1 : "          correction = MALLOC_ALIGNMENT - front_misalign;\n" +
    6226           1 : "          p = (mchunkptr)(mm + correction);\n" +
    6227           1 : "          p->prev_size = correction;\n" +
    6228           1 : "          set_head(p, (size - correction) |IS_MMAPPED);\n" +
    6229           1 : "        }\n" +
    6230           1 : "        else {\n" +
    6231           1 : "          p = (mchunkptr)mm;\n" +
    6232           1 : "          p->prev_size = 0;\n" +
    6233           1 : "          set_head(p, size|IS_MMAPPED);\n" +
    6234           1 : "        }\n" +
    6235           1 : "\n" +
    6236           1 : "        /* update statistics */\n" +
    6237           1 : "\n" +
    6238           1 : "        if (++av->n_mmaps > av->max_n_mmaps)\n" +
    6239           1 : "          av->max_n_mmaps = av->n_mmaps;\n" +
    6240           1 : "\n") +
    6241           1 : (
    6242           1 : "        sum = av->mmapped_mem += size;\n" +
    6243           1 : "        if (sum > (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_mmapped_mem))\n" +
    6244           1 : "          av->max_mmapped_mem = sum;\n" +
    6245           1 : "        sum += av->sbrked_mem;\n" +
    6246           1 : "        if (sum > (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_total_mem))\n" +
    6247           1 : "          av->max_total_mem = sum;\n" +
    6248           1 : "\n" +
    6249           1 : "        check_chunk(p);\n" +
    6250           1 : "\n" +
    6251           1 : "        return chunk2mem(p);\n" +
    6252           1 : "      }\n" +
    6253           1 : "    }\n" +
    6254           1 : "  }\n" +
    6255           1 : "#endif\n" +
    6256           1 : "\n" +
    6257           1 : "  /* Record incoming configuration of top */\n" +
    6258           1 : "\n" +
    6259           1 : "  old_top  = av->top;\n" +
    6260           1 : "  old_size = chunksize(old_top);\n" +
    6261           1 : "  old_end  = (char*)(chunk_at_offset(old_top, old_size));\n" +
    6262           1 : "\n" +
    6263           1 : "  brk = snd_brk = (char*)(MORECORE_FAILURE);\n" +
    6264           1 : "\n" +
    6265           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6266           1 : "     If not the first time through, we require old_size to be\n" +
    6267           1 : "     at least MINSIZE and to have prev_inuse set.\n" +
    6268           1 : "  */\n" +
    6269           1 : "\n" +
    6270           1 : "  assert((old_top == initial_top(av) && old_size == 0) ||\n" +
    6271           1 : "         ((CHUNK_SIZE_T) (old_size) >= MINSIZE &&\n" +
    6272           1 : "          prev_inuse(old_top)));\n" +
    6273           1 : "\n" +
    6274           1 : "  /* Precondition: not enough current space to satisfy nb request */\n" +
    6275           1 : "  assert((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(old_size) < (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb + MINSIZE));\n" +
    6276           1 : "\n" +
    6277           1 : "  /* Precondition: all fastbins are consolidated */\n" +
    6278           1 : "  assert(!have_fastchunks(av));\n" +
    6279           1 : "\n" +
    6280           1 : "\n" +
    6281           1 : "  /* Request enough space for nb + pad + overhead */\n" +
    6282           1 : "\n" +
    6283           1 : "  size = nb + av->top_pad + MINSIZE;\n" +
    6284           1 : "\n" +
    6285           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6286           1 : "    If contiguous, we can subtract out existing space that we hope to\n" +
    6287           1 : "    combine with new space. We add it back later only if\n" +
    6288           1 : "    we don't actually get contiguous space.\n" +
    6289           1 : "  */\n" +
    6290           1 : "\n" +
    6291           1 : "  if (contiguous(av))\n" +
    6292           1 : "    size -= old_size;\n" +
    6293           1 : "\n" +
    6294           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6295           1 : "    Round to a multiple of page size.\n" +
    6296           1 : "    If MORECORE is not contiguous, this ensures that we only call it\n" +
    6297           1 : "    with whole-page arguments.  And if MORECORE is contiguous and\n" +
    6298           1 : "    this is not first time through, this preserves page-alignment of\n" +
    6299           1 : "    previous calls. Otherwise, we correct to page-align below.\n" +
    6300           1 : "  */\n" +
    6301           1 : "\n" +
    6302           1 : "  size = (size + pagemask) & ~pagemask;\n" +
    6303           1 : "\n" +
    6304           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6305           1 : "    Don't try to call MORECORE if argument is so big as to appear\n" +
    6306           1 : "    negative. Note that since mmap takes size_t arg, it may succeed\n" +
    6307           1 : "    below even if we cannot call MORECORE.\n" +
    6308           1 : "  */\n" +
    6309           1 : "\n" +
    6310           1 : "  if (size > 0)\n" +
    6311           1 : "    brk = (char*)(MORECORE(size));\n" +
    6312           1 : "\n" +
    6313           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6314           1 : "    If have mmap, try using it as a backup when MORECORE fails or\n" +
    6315           1 : "    cannot be used. This is worth doing on systems that have \"holes\" in\n" +
    6316           1 : "    address space, so sbrk cannot extend to give contiguous space, but\n" +
    6317           1 : "    space is available elsewhere.  Note that we ignore mmap max count\n" +
    6318           1 : "    and threshold limits, since the space will not be used as a\n" +
    6319           1 : "    segregated mmap region.\n" +
    6320           1 : "  */\n" +
    6321           1 : "\n" +
    6322           1 : "#if HAVE_MMAP\n" +
    6323           1 : "  if (brk == (char*)(MORECORE_FAILURE)) {\n" +
    6324           1 : "\n" +
    6325           1 : "    /* Cannot merge with old top, so add its size back in */\n" +
    6326           1 : "    if (contiguous(av))\n" +
    6327           1 : "      size = (size + old_size + pagemask) & ~pagemask;\n" +
    6328           1 : "\n" +
    6329           1 : "    /* If we are relying on mmap as backup, then use larger units */\n" +
    6330           1 : "    if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) < (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(MMAP_AS_MORECORE_SIZE))\n" +
    6331           1 : "      size = MMAP_AS_MORECORE_SIZE;\n" +
    6332           1 : "\n" +
    6333           1 : "    /* Don't try if size wraps around 0 */\n" +
    6334           1 : "    if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) > (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb)) {\n" +
    6335           1 : "\n" +
    6336           1 : "      brk = (char*)(MMAP(0, size, PROT_READ|PROT_WRITE, MAP_PRIVATE));\n" +
    6337           1 : "\n" +
    6338           1 : "      if (brk != (char*)(MORECORE_FAILURE)) {\n" +
    6339           1 : "\n" +
    6340           1 : "        /* We do not need, and cannot use, another sbrk call to find end */\n" +
    6341           1 : "        snd_brk = brk + size;\n" +
    6342           1 : "\n" +
    6343           1 : "        /*\n" +
    6344           1 : "           Record that we no longer have a contiguous sbrk region.\n" +
    6345           1 : "           After the first time mmap is used as backup, we do not\n" +
    6346           1 : "           ever rely on contiguous space since this could incorrectly\n" +
    6347           1 : "           bridge regions.\n" +
    6348           1 : "        */\n" +
    6349           1 : "        set_noncontiguous(av);\n" +
    6350           1 : "      }\n" +
    6351           1 : "    }\n" +
    6352           1 : "  }\n" +
    6353           1 : "#endif\n" +
    6354           1 : "\n" +
    6355           1 : "  if (brk != (char*)(MORECORE_FAILURE)) {\n" +
    6356           1 : "    av->sbrked_mem += size;\n" +
    6357           1 : "\n" +
    6358           1 : "    /*\n" +
    6359           1 : "      If MORECORE extends previous space, we can likewise extend top size.\n" +
    6360           1 : "    */\n" +
    6361           1 : "\n" +
    6362           1 : "    if (brk == old_end && snd_brk == (char*)(MORECORE_FAILURE)) {\n" +
    6363           1 : "      set_head(old_top, (size + old_size) | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6364           1 : "    }\n" +
    6365           1 : "\n" +
    6366           1 : "    /*\n" +
    6367           1 : "      Otherwise, make adjustments:\n" +
    6368           1 : "\n" +
    6369           1 : "      * If the first time through or noncontiguous, we need to call sbrk\n" +
    6370           1 : "        just to find out where the end of memory lies.\n" +
    6371           1 : "\n" +
    6372           1 : "      * We need to ensure that all returned chunks from malloc will meet\n" +
    6373           1 : "        MALLOC_ALIGNMENT\n" +
    6374           1 : "\n" +
    6375           1 : "      * If there was an intervening foreign sbrk, we need to adjust sbrk\n" +
    6376           1 : "        request size to account for fact that we will not be able to\n" +
    6377           1 : "        combine new space with existing space in old_top.\n" +
    6378           1 : "\n" +
    6379           1 : "      * Almost all systems internally allocate whole pages at a time, in\n" +
    6380           1 : "        which case we might as well use the whole last page of request.\n" +
    6381           1 : "        So we allocate enough more memory to hit a page boundary now,\n" +
    6382           1 : "        which in turn causes future contiguous calls to page-align.\n" +
    6383           1 : "    */\n" +
    6384           1 : "\n" +
    6385           1 : "    else {\n" +
    6386           1 : "      front_misalign = 0;\n" +
    6387           1 : "      end_misalign = 0;\n" +
    6388           1 : "      correction = 0;\n" +
    6389           1 : "      aligned_brk = brk;\n" +
    6390           1 : "\n") +
    6391           1 : (
    6392           1 : "      /*\n" +
    6393           1 : "        If MORECORE returns an address lower than we have seen before,\n" +
    6394           1 : "        we know it isn't really contiguous.  This and some subsequent\n" +
    6395           1 : "        checks help cope with non-conforming MORECORE functions and\n" +
    6396           1 : "        the presence of \"foreign\" calls to MORECORE from outside of\n" +
    6397           1 : "        malloc or by other threads.  We cannot guarantee to detect\n" +
    6398           1 : "        these in all cases, but cope with the ones we do detect.\n" +
    6399           1 : "      */\n" +
    6400           1 : "      if (contiguous(av) && old_size != 0 && brk < old_end) {\n" +
    6401           1 : "        set_noncontiguous(av);\n" +
    6402           1 : "      }\n" +
    6403           1 : "\n" +
    6404           1 : "      /* handle contiguous cases */\n" +
    6405           1 : "      if (contiguous(av)) {\n" +
    6406           1 : "\n" +
    6407           1 : "        /*\n" +
    6408           1 : "           We can tolerate forward non-contiguities here (usually due\n" +
    6409           1 : "           to foreign calls) but treat them as part of our space for\n" +
    6410           1 : "           stats reporting.\n" +
    6411           1 : "        */\n" +
    6412           1 : "        if (old_size != 0)\n" +
    6413           1 : "          av->sbrked_mem += brk - old_end;\n" +
    6414           1 : "\n" +
    6415           1 : "        /* Guarantee alignment of first new chunk made from this space */\n" +
    6416           1 : "\n" +
    6417           1 : "        front_misalign = (INTERNAL_SIZE_T)chunk2mem(brk) & MALLOC_ALIGN_MASK;\n" +
    6418           1 : "        if (front_misalign > 0) {\n" +
    6419           1 : "\n" +
    6420           1 : "          /*\n" +
    6421           1 : "            Skip over some bytes to arrive at an aligned position.\n" +
    6422           1 : "            We don't need to specially mark these wasted front bytes.\n" +
    6423           1 : "            They will never be accessed anyway because\n" +
    6424           1 : "            prev_inuse of av->top (and any chunk created from its start)\n" +
    6425           1 : "            is always true after initialization.\n" +
    6426           1 : "          */\n" +
    6427           1 : "\n" +
    6428           1 : "          correction = MALLOC_ALIGNMENT - front_misalign;\n" +
    6429           1 : "          aligned_brk += correction;\n" +
    6430           1 : "        }\n" +
    6431           1 : "\n" +
    6432           1 : "        /*\n" +
    6433           1 : "          If this isn't adjacent to existing space, then we will not\n" +
    6434           1 : "          be able to merge with old_top space, so must add to 2nd request.\n" +
    6435           1 : "        */\n" +
    6436           1 : "\n" +
    6437           1 : "        correction += old_size;\n" +
    6438           1 : "\n" +
    6439           1 : "        /* Extend the end address to hit a page boundary */\n" +
    6440           1 : "        end_misalign = (INTERNAL_SIZE_T)(brk + size + correction);\n" +
    6441           1 : "        correction += ((end_misalign + pagemask) & ~pagemask) - end_misalign;\n" +
    6442           1 : "\n" +
    6443           1 : "        assert(correction >= 0);\n" +
    6444           1 : "        snd_brk = (char*)(MORECORE(correction));\n" +
    6445           1 : "\n" +
    6446           1 : "        if (snd_brk == (char*)(MORECORE_FAILURE)) {\n" +
    6447           1 : "          /*\n" +
    6448           1 : "            If can't allocate correction, try to at least find out current\n" +
    6449           1 : "            brk.  It might be enough to proceed without failing.\n" +
    6450           1 : "          */\n" +
    6451           1 : "          correction = 0;\n" +
    6452           1 : "          snd_brk = (char*)(MORECORE(0));\n" +
    6453           1 : "        }\n" +
    6454           1 : "        else if (snd_brk < brk) {\n" +
    6455           1 : "          /*\n" +
    6456           1 : "            If the second call gives noncontiguous space even though\n" +
    6457           1 : "            it says it won't, the only course of action is to ignore\n" +
    6458           1 : "            results of second call, and conservatively estimate where\n" +
    6459           1 : "            the first call left us. Also set noncontiguous, so this\n" +
    6460           1 : "            won't happen again, leaving at most one hole.\n" +
    6461           1 : "\n" +
    6462           1 : "            Note that this check is intrinsically incomplete.  Because\n" +
    6463           1 : "            MORECORE is allowed to give more space than we ask for,\n" +
    6464           1 : "            there is no reliable way to detect a noncontiguity\n" +
    6465           1 : "            producing a forward gap for the second call.\n" +
    6466           1 : "          */\n" +
    6467           1 : "          snd_brk = brk + size;\n" +
    6468           1 : "          correction = 0;\n" +
    6469           1 : "          set_noncontiguous(av);\n" +
    6470           1 : "        }\n" +
    6471           1 : "\n" +
    6472           1 : "      }\n" +
    6473           1 : "\n" +
    6474           1 : "      /* handle non-contiguous cases */\n" +
    6475           1 : "      else {\n" +
    6476           1 : "        /* MORECORE/mmap must correctly align */\n" +
    6477           1 : "        assert(aligned_OK(chunk2mem(brk)));\n" +
    6478           1 : "\n" +
    6479           1 : "        /* Find out current end of memory */\n" +
    6480           1 : "        if (snd_brk == (char*)(MORECORE_FAILURE)) {\n" +
    6481           1 : "          snd_brk = (char*)(MORECORE(0));\n" +
    6482           1 : "          av->sbrked_mem += snd_brk - brk - size;\n" +
    6483           1 : "        }\n" +
    6484           1 : "      }\n" +
    6485           1 : "\n" +
    6486           1 : "      /* Adjust top based on results of second sbrk */\n" +
    6487           1 : "      if (snd_brk != (char*)(MORECORE_FAILURE)) {\n" +
    6488           1 : "        av->top = (mchunkptr)aligned_brk;\n" +
    6489           1 : "        set_head(av->top, (snd_brk - aligned_brk + correction) | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6490           1 : "        av->sbrked_mem += correction;\n" +
    6491           1 : "\n" +
    6492           1 : "        /*\n" +
    6493           1 : "          If not the first time through, we either have a\n" +
    6494           1 : "          gap due to foreign sbrk or a non-contiguous region.  Insert a\n" +
    6495           1 : "          double fencepost at old_top to prevent consolidation with space\n" +
    6496           1 : "          we don't own. These fenceposts are artificial chunks that are\n" +
    6497           1 : "          marked as inuse and are in any case too small to use.  We need\n" +
    6498           1 : "          two to make sizes and alignments work out.\n" +
    6499           1 : "        */\n" +
    6500           1 : "\n" +
    6501           1 : "        if (old_size != 0) {\n" +
    6502           1 : "          /*\n" +
    6503           1 : "             Shrink old_top to insert fenceposts, keeping size a\n" +
    6504           1 : "             multiple of MALLOC_ALIGNMENT. We know there is at least\n" +
    6505           1 : "             enough space in old_top to do this.\n" +
    6506           1 : "          */\n" +
    6507           1 : "          old_size = (old_size - 3*SIZE_SZ) & ~MALLOC_ALIGN_MASK;\n" +
    6508           1 : "          set_head(old_top, old_size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6509           1 : "\n" +
    6510           1 : "          /*\n" +
    6511           1 : "            Note that the following assignments completely overwrite\n" +
    6512           1 : "            old_top when old_size was previously MINSIZE.  This is\n" +
    6513           1 : "            intentional. We need the fencepost, even if old_top otherwise gets\n" +
    6514           1 : "            lost.\n" +
    6515           1 : "          */\n" +
    6516           1 : "          chunk_at_offset(old_top, old_size          )->size =\n" +
    6517           1 : "            SIZE_SZ|PREV_INUSE;\n" +
    6518           1 : "\n" +
    6519           1 : "          chunk_at_offset(old_top, old_size + SIZE_SZ)->size =\n" +
    6520           1 : "            SIZE_SZ|PREV_INUSE;\n" +
    6521           1 : "\n" +
    6522           1 : "          /*\n" +
    6523           1 : "             If possible, release the rest, suppressing trimming.\n" +
    6524           1 : "          */\n" +
    6525           1 : "          if (old_size >= MINSIZE) {\n" +
    6526           1 : "            INTERNAL_SIZE_T tt = av->trim_threshold;\n" +
    6527           1 : "            av->trim_threshold = (INTERNAL_SIZE_T)(-1);\n" +
    6528           1 : "            fREe(chunk2mem(old_top));\n" +
    6529           1 : "            av->trim_threshold = tt;\n" +
    6530           1 : "          }\n" +
    6531           1 : "        }\n" +
    6532           1 : "      }\n" +
    6533           1 : "    }\n" +
    6534           1 : "\n" +
    6535           1 : "    /* Update statistics */\n" +
    6536           1 : "    sum = av->sbrked_mem;\n" +
    6537           1 : "    if (sum > (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_sbrked_mem))\n" +
    6538           1 : "      av->max_sbrked_mem = sum;\n" +
    6539           1 : "\n") +
    6540           1 : (
    6541           1 : "    sum += av->mmapped_mem;\n" +
    6542           1 : "    if (sum > (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_total_mem))\n" +
    6543           1 : "      av->max_total_mem = sum;\n" +
    6544           1 : "\n" +
    6545           1 : "    check_malloc_state();\n" +
    6546           1 : "\n" +
    6547           1 : "    /* finally, do the allocation */\n" +
    6548           1 : "\n" +
    6549           1 : "    p = av->top;\n" +
    6550           1 : "    size = chunksize(p);\n" +
    6551           1 : "\n" +
    6552           1 : "    /* check that one of the above allocation paths succeeded */\n" +
    6553           1 : "    if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) >= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb + MINSIZE)) {\n" +
    6554           1 : "      remainder_size = size - nb;\n" +
    6555           1 : "      remainder = chunk_at_offset(p, nb);\n" +
    6556           1 : "      av->top = remainder;\n" +
    6557           1 : "      set_head(p, nb | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6558           1 : "      set_head(remainder, remainder_size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6559           1 : "      check_malloced_chunk(p, nb);\n" +
    6560           1 : "      return chunk2mem(p);\n" +
    6561           1 : "    }\n" +
    6562           1 : "\n" +
    6563           1 : "  }\n" +
    6564           1 : "\n" +
    6565           1 : "  /* catch all failure paths */\n" +
    6566           1 : "  MALLOC_FAILURE_ACTION;\n" +
    6567           1 : "  return 0;\n" +
    6568           1 : "}\n" +
    6569           1 : "\n" +
    6570           1 : "\n" +
    6571           1 : "\n" +
    6572           1 : "\n" +
    6573           1 : "/*\n" +
    6574           1 : "  sYSTRIm is an inverse of sorts to sYSMALLOc.  It gives memory back\n" +
    6575           1 : "  to the system (via negative arguments to sbrk) if there is unused\n" +
    6576           1 : "  memory at the `high' end of the malloc pool. It is called\n" +
    6577           1 : "  automatically by free() when top space exceeds the trim\n" +
    6578           1 : "  threshold. It is also called by the public malloc_trim routine.  It\n" +
    6579           1 : "  returns 1 if it actually released any memory, else 0.\n" +
    6580           1 : "*/\n" +
    6581           1 : "\n" +
    6582           1 : "#ifndef MORECORE_CANNOT_TRIM\n" +
    6583           1 : "\n" +
    6584           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    6585           1 : "static int sYSTRIm(size_t pad, mstate av)\n" +
    6586           1 : "#else\n" +
    6587           1 : "static int sYSTRIm(pad, av) size_t pad; mstate av;\n" +
    6588           1 : "#endif\n" +
    6589           1 : "{\n" +
    6590           1 : "  long  top_size;        /* Amount of top-most memory */\n" +
    6591           1 : "  long  extra;           /* Amount to release */\n" +
    6592           1 : "  long  released;        /* Amount actually released */\n" +
    6593           1 : "  char* current_brk;     /* address returned by pre-check sbrk call */\n" +
    6594           1 : "  char* new_brk;         /* address returned by post-check sbrk call */\n" +
    6595           1 : "  size_t pagesz;\n" +
    6596           1 : "\n" +
    6597           1 : "  pagesz = av->pagesize;\n" +
    6598           1 : "  top_size = chunksize(av->top);\n" +
    6599           1 : "\n" +
    6600           1 : "  /* Release in pagesize units, keeping at least one page */\n" +
    6601           1 : "  extra = ((top_size - pad - MINSIZE + (pagesz-1)) / pagesz - 1) * pagesz;\n" +
    6602           1 : "\n" +
    6603           1 : "  if (extra > 0) {\n" +
    6604           1 : "\n" +
    6605           1 : "    /*\n" +
    6606           1 : "      Only proceed if end of memory is where we last set it.\n" +
    6607           1 : "      This avoids problems if there were foreign sbrk calls.\n" +
    6608           1 : "    */\n" +
    6609           1 : "    current_brk = (char*)(MORECORE(0));\n" +
    6610           1 : "    if (current_brk == (char*)(av->top) + top_size) {\n" +
    6611           1 : "\n" +
    6612           1 : "      /*\n" +
    6613           1 : "        Attempt to release memory. We ignore MORECORE return value,\n" +
    6614           1 : "        and instead call again to find out where new end of memory is.\n" +
    6615           1 : "        This avoids problems if first call releases less than we asked,\n" +
    6616           1 : "        of if failure somehow altered brk value. (We could still\n" +
    6617           1 : "        encounter problems if it altered brk in some very bad way,\n" +
    6618           1 : "        but the only thing we can do is adjust anyway, which will cause\n" +
    6619           1 : "        some downstream failure.)\n" +
    6620           1 : "      */\n" +
    6621           1 : "\n" +
    6622           1 : "      MORECORE(-extra);\n" +
    6623           1 : "      new_brk = (char*)(MORECORE(0));\n" +
    6624           1 : "\n" +
    6625           1 : "      if (new_brk != (char*)MORECORE_FAILURE) {\n" +
    6626           1 : "        released = (long)(current_brk - new_brk);\n" +
    6627           1 : "\n" +
    6628           1 : "        if (released != 0) {\n" +
    6629           1 : "          /* Success. Adjust top. */\n" +
    6630           1 : "          av->sbrked_mem -= released;\n" +
    6631           1 : "          set_head(av->top, (top_size - released) | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6632           1 : "          check_malloc_state();\n" +
    6633           1 : "          return 1;\n" +
    6634           1 : "        }\n" +
    6635           1 : "      }\n" +
    6636           1 : "    }\n" +
    6637           1 : "  }\n" +
    6638           1 : "  return 0;\n" +
    6639           1 : "}\n" +
    6640           1 : "\n" +
    6641           1 : "#endif\n" +
    6642           1 : "\n" +
    6643           1 : "/*\n" +
    6644           1 : "  ------------------------------ malloc ------------------------------\n" +
    6645           1 : "*/\n" +
    6646           1 : "\n" +
    6647           1 : "\n" +
    6648           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    6649           1 : "Void_t* mALLOc(size_t bytes)\n" +
    6650           1 : "#else\n" +
    6651           1 : "  Void_t* mALLOc(bytes) size_t bytes;\n" +
    6652           1 : "#endif\n" +
    6653           1 : "{\n" +
    6654           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    6655           1 : "\n" +
    6656           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T nb;               /* normalized request size */\n" +
    6657           1 : "  unsigned int    idx;              /* associated bin index */\n" +
    6658           1 : "  mbinptr         bin;              /* associated bin */\n" +
    6659           1 : "  mfastbinptr*    fb;               /* associated fastbin */\n" +
    6660           1 : "\n" +
    6661           1 : "  mchunkptr       victim;           /* inspected/selected chunk */\n" +
    6662           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T size;             /* its size */\n" +
    6663           1 : "  int             victim_index;     /* its bin index */\n" +
    6664           1 : "\n" +
    6665           1 : "  mchunkptr       remainder;        /* remainder from a split */\n" +
    6666           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T    remainder_size;   /* its size */\n" +
    6667           1 : "\n" +
    6668           1 : "  unsigned int    block;            /* bit map traverser */\n" +
    6669           1 : "  unsigned int    bit;              /* bit map traverser */\n" +
    6670           1 : "  unsigned int    map;              /* current word of binmap */\n" +
    6671           1 : "\n" +
    6672           1 : "  mchunkptr       fwd;              /* misc temp for linking */\n" +
    6673           1 : "  mchunkptr       bck;              /* misc temp for linking */\n" +
    6674           1 : "\n" +
    6675           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6676           1 : "    Convert request size to internal form by adding SIZE_SZ bytes\n" +
    6677           1 : "    overhead plus possibly more to obtain necessary alignment and/or\n" +
    6678           1 : "    to obtain a size of at least MINSIZE, the smallest allocatable\n" +
    6679           1 : "    size. Also, checked_request2size traps (returning 0) request sizes\n" +
    6680           1 : "    that are so large that they wrap around zero when padded and\n" +
    6681           1 : "    aligned.\n" +
    6682           1 : "  */\n" +
    6683           1 : "\n" +
    6684           1 : "  checked_request2size(bytes, nb);\n" +
    6685           1 : "\n" +
    6686           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6687           1 : "    Bypass search if no frees yet\n" +
    6688           1 : "   */\n" +
    6689           1 : "  if (!have_anychunks(av)) {\n" +
    6690           1 : "    if (av->max_fast == 0) /* initialization check */\n" +
    6691           1 : "      malloc_consolidate(av);\n" +
    6692           1 : "    goto use_top;\n" +
    6693           1 : "  }\n" +
    6694           1 : "\n") +
    6695           1 : (
    6696           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6697           1 : "    If the size qualifies as a fastbin, first check corresponding bin.\n" +
    6698           1 : "  */\n" +
    6699           1 : "\n" +
    6700           1 : "  if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb) <= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_fast)) {\n" +
    6701           1 : "    fb = &(av->fastbins[(fastbin_index(nb))]);\n" +
    6702           1 : "    if ( (victim = *fb) != 0) {\n" +
    6703           1 : "      *fb = victim->fd;\n" +
    6704           1 : "      check_remalloced_chunk(victim, nb);\n" +
    6705           1 : "      return chunk2mem(victim);\n" +
    6706           1 : "    }\n" +
    6707           1 : "  }\n" +
    6708           1 : "\n" +
    6709           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6710           1 : "    If a small request, check regular bin.  Since these \"smallbins\"\n" +
    6711           1 : "    hold one size each, no searching within bins is necessary.\n" +
    6712           1 : "    (For a large request, we need to wait until unsorted chunks are\n" +
    6713           1 : "    processed to find best fit. But for small ones, fits are exact\n" +
    6714           1 : "    anyway, so we can check now, which is faster.)\n" +
    6715           1 : "  */\n" +
    6716           1 : "\n" +
    6717           1 : "  if (in_smallbin_range(nb)) {\n" +
    6718           1 : "    idx = smallbin_index(nb);\n" +
    6719           1 : "    bin = bin_at(av,idx);\n" +
    6720           1 : "\n" +
    6721           1 : "    if ( (victim = last(bin)) != bin) {\n" +
    6722           1 : "      bck = victim->bk;\n" +
    6723           1 : "      set_inuse_bit_at_offset(victim, nb);\n" +
    6724           1 : "      bin->bk = bck;\n" +
    6725           1 : "      bck->fd = bin;\n" +
    6726           1 : "\n" +
