    6727           1 : "      check_malloced_chunk(victim, nb);\n" +
    6728           1 : "      return chunk2mem(victim);\n" +
    6729           1 : "    }\n" +
    6730           1 : "  }\n" +
    6731           1 : "\n" +
    6732           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6733           1 : "     If this is a large request, consolidate fastbins before continuing.\n" +
    6734           1 : "     While it might look excessive to kill all fastbins before\n" +
    6735           1 : "     even seeing if there is space available, this avoids\n" +
    6736           1 : "     fragmentation problems normally associated with fastbins.\n" +
    6737           1 : "     Also, in practice, programs tend to have runs of either small or\n" +
    6738           1 : "     large requests, but less often mixtures, so consolidation is not\n" +
    6739           1 : "     invoked all that often in most programs. And the programs that\n" +
    6740           1 : "     it is called frequently in otherwise tend to fragment.\n" +
    6741           1 : "  */\n" +
    6742           1 : "\n" +
    6743           1 : "  else {\n" +
    6744           1 : "    idx = largebin_index(nb);\n" +
    6745           1 : "    if (have_fastchunks(av))\n" +
    6746           1 : "      malloc_consolidate(av);\n" +
    6747           1 : "  }\n" +
    6748           1 : "\n" +
    6749           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6750           1 : "    Process recently freed or remaindered chunks, taking one only if\n" +
    6751           1 : "    it is exact fit, or, if this a small request, the chunk is remainder from\n" +
    6752           1 : "    the most recent non-exact fit.  Place other traversed chunks in\n" +
    6753           1 : "    bins.  Note that this step is the only place in any routine where\n" +
    6754           1 : "    chunks are placed in bins.\n" +
    6755           1 : "  */\n" +
    6756           1 : "\n" +
    6757           1 : "  while ( (victim = unsorted_chunks(av)->bk) != unsorted_chunks(av)) {\n" +
    6758           1 : "    bck = victim->bk;\n" +
    6759           1 : "    size = chunksize(victim);\n" +
    6760           1 : "\n" +
    6761           1 : "    /*\n" +
    6762           1 : "       If a small request, try to use last remainder if it is the\n" +
    6763           1 : "       only chunk in unsorted bin.  This helps promote locality for\n" +
    6764           1 : "       runs of consecutive small requests. This is the only\n" +
    6765           1 : "       exception to best-fit, and applies only when there is\n" +
    6766           1 : "       no exact fit for a small chunk.\n" +
    6767           1 : "    */\n" +
    6768           1 : "\n" +
    6769           1 : "    if (in_smallbin_range(nb) &&\n" +
    6770           1 : "        bck == unsorted_chunks(av) &&\n" +
    6771           1 : "        victim == av->last_remainder &&\n" +
    6772           1 : "        (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) > (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb + MINSIZE)) {\n" +
    6773           1 : "\n" +
    6774           1 : "      /* split and reattach remainder */\n" +
    6775           1 : "      remainder_size = size - nb;\n" +
    6776           1 : "      remainder = chunk_at_offset(victim, nb);\n" +
    6777           1 : "      unsorted_chunks(av)->bk = unsorted_chunks(av)->fd = remainder;\n" +
    6778           1 : "      av->last_remainder = remainder;\n" +
    6779           1 : "      remainder->bk = remainder->fd = unsorted_chunks(av);\n" +
    6780           1 : "\n" +
    6781           1 : "      set_head(victim, nb | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6782           1 : "      set_head(remainder, remainder_size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6783           1 : "      set_foot(remainder, remainder_size);\n" +
    6784           1 : "\n" +
    6785           1 : "      check_malloced_chunk(victim, nb);\n" +
    6786           1 : "      return chunk2mem(victim);\n" +
    6787           1 : "    }\n" +
    6788           1 : "\n" +
    6789           1 : "    /* remove from unsorted list */\n" +
    6790           1 : "    unsorted_chunks(av)->bk = bck;\n" +
    6791           1 : "    bck->fd = unsorted_chunks(av);\n" +
    6792           1 : "\n" +
    6793           1 : "    /* Take now instead of binning if exact fit */\n" +
    6794           1 : "\n" +
    6795           1 : "    if (size == nb) {\n" +
    6796           1 : "      set_inuse_bit_at_offset(victim, size);\n" +
    6797           1 : "      check_malloced_chunk(victim, nb);\n" +
    6798           1 : "      return chunk2mem(victim);\n" +
    6799           1 : "    }\n" +
    6800           1 : "\n" +
    6801           1 : "    /* place chunk in bin */\n" +
    6802           1 : "\n" +
    6803           1 : "    if (in_smallbin_range(size)) {\n" +
    6804           1 : "      victim_index = smallbin_index(size);\n" +
    6805           1 : "      bck = bin_at(av, victim_index);\n" +
    6806           1 : "      fwd = bck->fd;\n" +
    6807           1 : "    }\n" +
    6808           1 : "    else {\n" +
    6809           1 : "      victim_index = largebin_index(size);\n" +
    6810           1 : "      bck = bin_at(av, victim_index);\n" +
    6811           1 : "      fwd = bck->fd;\n" +
    6812           1 : "\n" +
    6813           1 : "      if (fwd != bck) {\n" +
    6814           1 : "        /* if smaller than smallest, place first */\n" +
    6815           1 : "        if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) < (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(bck->bk->size)) {\n" +
    6816           1 : "          fwd = bck;\n" +
    6817           1 : "          bck = bck->bk;\n" +
    6818           1 : "        }\n" +
    6819           1 : "        else if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) >=\n" +
    6820           1 : "                 (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(FIRST_SORTED_BIN_SIZE)) {\n" +
    6821           1 : "\n" +
    6822           1 : "          /* maintain large bins in sorted order */\n" +
    6823           1 : "          size |= PREV_INUSE; /* Or with inuse bit to speed comparisons */\n" +
    6824           1 : "          while ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) < (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(fwd->size))\n" +
    6825           1 : "            fwd = fwd->fd;\n" +
    6826           1 : "          bck = fwd->bk;\n" +
    6827           1 : "        }\n" +
    6828           1 : "      }\n" +
    6829           1 : "    }\n" +
    6830           1 : "\n" +
    6831           1 : "    mark_bin(av, victim_index);\n" +
    6832           1 : "    victim->bk = bck;\n" +
    6833           1 : "    victim->fd = fwd;\n" +
    6834           1 : "    fwd->bk = victim;\n" +
    6835           1 : "    bck->fd = victim;\n" +
    6836           1 : "  }\n" +
    6837           1 : "\n" +
    6838           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6839           1 : "    If a large request, scan through the chunks of current bin to\n" +
    6840           1 : "    find one that fits.  (This will be the smallest that fits unless\n" +
    6841           1 : "    FIRST_SORTED_BIN_SIZE has been changed from default.)  This is\n" +
    6842           1 : "    the only step where an unbounded number of chunks might be\n" +
    6843           1 : "    scanned without doing anything useful with them. However the\n" +
    6844           1 : "    lists tend to be short.\n" +
    6845           1 : "  */\n" +
    6846           1 : "\n") +
    6847           1 : (
    6848           1 : "  if (!in_smallbin_range(nb)) {\n" +
    6849           1 : "    bin = bin_at(av, idx);\n" +
    6850           1 : "\n" +
    6851           1 : "    for (victim = last(bin); victim != bin; victim = victim->bk) {\n" +
    6852           1 : "      size = chunksize(victim);\n" +
    6853           1 : "\n" +
    6854           1 : "      if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) >= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb)) {\n" +
    6855           1 : "        remainder_size = size - nb;\n" +
    6856           1 : "        unlink(victim, bck, fwd);\n" +
    6857           1 : "\n" +
    6858           1 : "        /* Exhaust */\n" +
    6859           1 : "        if (remainder_size < MINSIZE)  {\n" +
    6860           1 : "          set_inuse_bit_at_offset(victim, size);\n" +
    6861           1 : "          check_malloced_chunk(victim, nb);\n" +
    6862           1 : "          return chunk2mem(victim);\n" +
    6863           1 : "        }\n" +
    6864           1 : "        /* Split */\n" +
    6865           1 : "        else {\n" +
    6866           1 : "          remainder = chunk_at_offset(victim, nb);\n" +
    6867           1 : "          unsorted_chunks(av)->bk = unsorted_chunks(av)->fd = remainder;\n" +
    6868           1 : "          remainder->bk = remainder->fd = unsorted_chunks(av);\n" +
    6869           1 : "          set_head(victim, nb | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6870           1 : "          set_head(remainder, remainder_size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6871           1 : "          set_foot(remainder, remainder_size);\n" +
    6872           1 : "          check_malloced_chunk(victim, nb);\n" +
    6873           1 : "          return chunk2mem(victim);\n" +
    6874           1 : "        }\n" +
    6875           1 : "      }\n" +
    6876           1 : "    }\n" +
    6877           1 : "  }\n" +
    6878           1 : "\n" +
    6879           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6880           1 : "    Search for a chunk by scanning bins, starting with next largest\n" +
    6881           1 : "    bin. This search is strictly by best-fit; i.e., the smallest\n" +
    6882           1 : "    (with ties going to approximately the least recently used) chunk\n" +
    6883           1 : "    that fits is selected.\n" +
    6884           1 : "\n" +
    6885           1 : "    The bitmap avoids needing to check that most blocks are nonempty.\n" +
    6886           1 : "  */\n" +
    6887           1 : "\n" +
    6888           1 : "  ++idx;\n" +
    6889           1 : "  bin = bin_at(av,idx);\n" +
    6890           1 : "  block = idx2block(idx);\n" +
    6891           1 : "  map = av->binmap[block];\n" +
    6892           1 : "  bit = idx2bit(idx);\n" +
    6893           1 : "\n" +
    6894           1 : "  for (;;) {\n" +
    6895           1 : "\n" +
    6896           1 : "    /* Skip rest of block if there are no more set bits in this block.  */\n" +
    6897           1 : "    if (bit > map || bit == 0) {\n" +
    6898           1 : "      do {\n" +
    6899           1 : "        if (++block >= BINMAPSIZE)  /* out of bins */\n" +
    6900           1 : "          goto use_top;\n" +
    6901           1 : "      } while ( (map = av->binmap[block]) == 0);\n" +
    6902           1 : "\n" +
    6903           1 : "      bin = bin_at(av, (block << BINMAPSHIFT));\n" +
    6904           1 : "      bit = 1;\n" +
    6905           1 : "    }\n" +
    6906           1 : "\n" +
    6907           1 : "    /* Advance to bin with set bit. There must be one. */\n" +
    6908           1 : "    while ((bit & map) == 0) {\n" +
    6909           1 : "      bin = next_bin(bin);\n" +
    6910           1 : "      bit <<= 1;\n" +
    6911           1 : "      assert(bit != 0);\n" +
    6912           1 : "    }\n" +
    6913           1 : "\n" +
    6914           1 : "    /* Inspect the bin. It is likely to be non-empty */\n" +
    6915           1 : "    victim = last(bin);\n" +
    6916           1 : "\n" +
    6917           1 : "    /*  If a false alarm (empty bin), clear the bit. */\n" +
    6918           1 : "    if (victim == bin) {\n" +
    6919           1 : "      av->binmap[block] = map &= ~bit; /* Write through */\n" +
    6920           1 : "      bin = next_bin(bin);\n" +
    6921           1 : "      bit <<= 1;\n" +
    6922           1 : "    }\n" +
    6923           1 : "\n" +
    6924           1 : "    else {\n" +
    6925           1 : "      size = chunksize(victim);\n" +
    6926           1 : "\n" +
    6927           1 : "      /*  We know the first chunk in this bin is big enough to use. */\n" +
    6928           1 : "      assert((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) >= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb));\n" +
    6929           1 : "\n" +
    6930           1 : "      remainder_size = size - nb;\n" +
    6931           1 : "\n" +
    6932           1 : "      /* unlink */\n" +
    6933           1 : "      bck = victim->bk;\n" +
    6934           1 : "      bin->bk = bck;\n" +
    6935           1 : "      bck->fd = bin;\n" +
    6936           1 : "\n" +
    6937           1 : "      /* Exhaust */\n" +
    6938           1 : "      if (remainder_size < MINSIZE) {\n" +
    6939           1 : "        set_inuse_bit_at_offset(victim, size);\n" +
    6940           1 : "        check_malloced_chunk(victim, nb);\n" +
    6941           1 : "        return chunk2mem(victim);\n" +
    6942           1 : "      }\n" +
    6943           1 : "\n" +
    6944           1 : "      /* Split */\n" +
    6945           1 : "      else {\n" +
    6946           1 : "        remainder = chunk_at_offset(victim, nb);\n" +
    6947           1 : "\n" +
    6948           1 : "        unsorted_chunks(av)->bk = unsorted_chunks(av)->fd = remainder;\n" +
    6949           1 : "        remainder->bk = remainder->fd = unsorted_chunks(av);\n" +
    6950           1 : "        /* advertise as last remainder */\n" +
    6951           1 : "        if (in_smallbin_range(nb))\n" +
    6952           1 : "          av->last_remainder = remainder;\n" +
    6953           1 : "\n" +
    6954           1 : "        set_head(victim, nb | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6955           1 : "        set_head(remainder, remainder_size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6956           1 : "        set_foot(remainder, remainder_size);\n" +
    6957           1 : "        check_malloced_chunk(victim, nb);\n" +
    6958           1 : "        return chunk2mem(victim);\n" +
    6959           1 : "      }\n" +
    6960           1 : "    }\n" +
    6961           1 : "  }\n" +
    6962           1 : "\n" +
    6963           1 : "  use_top:\n" +
    6964           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6965           1 : "    If large enough, split off the chunk bordering the end of memory\n" +
    6966           1 : "    (held in av->top). Note that this is in accord with the best-fit\n" +
    6967           1 : "    search rule.  In effect, av->top is treated as larger (and thus\n" +
    6968           1 : "    less well fitting) than any other available chunk since it can\n" +
    6969           1 : "    be extended to be as large as necessary (up to system\n" +
    6970           1 : "    limitations).\n" +
    6971           1 : "\n" +
    6972           1 : "    We require that av->top always exists (i.e., has size >=\n" +
    6973           1 : "    MINSIZE) after initialization, so if it would otherwise be\n" +
    6974           1 : "    exhuasted by current request, it is replenished. (The main\n" +
    6975           1 : "    reason for ensuring it exists is that we may need MINSIZE space\n" +
    6976           1 : "    to put in fenceposts in sysmalloc.)\n" +
    6977           1 : "  */\n" +
    6978           1 : "\n" +
    6979           1 : "  victim = av->top;\n" +
    6980           1 : "  size = chunksize(victim);\n" +
    6981           1 : "\n" +
    6982           1 : "  if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) >= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb + MINSIZE)) {\n" +
    6983           1 : "    remainder_size = size - nb;\n" +
    6984           1 : "    remainder = chunk_at_offset(victim, nb);\n" +
    6985           1 : "    av->top = remainder;\n" +
    6986           1 : "    set_head(victim, nb | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6987           1 : "    set_head(remainder, remainder_size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    6988           1 : "\n" +
    6989           1 : "    check_malloced_chunk(victim, nb);\n" +
    6990           1 : "    return chunk2mem(victim);\n" +
    6991           1 : "  }\n" +
    6992           1 : "\n" +
    6993           1 : "  /*\n" +
    6994           1 : "     If no space in top, relay to handle system-dependent cases\n" +
    6995           1 : "  */\n" +
    6996           1 : "  return sYSMALLOc(nb, av);\n" +
    6997           1 : "}\n" +
    6998           1 : "\n") +
    6999           1 : (
    7000           1 : "/*\n" +
    7001           1 : "  ------------------------------ free ------------------------------\n" +
    7002           1 : "*/\n" +
    7003           1 : "\n" +
    7004           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7005           1 : "void fREe(Void_t* mem)\n" +
    7006           1 : "#else\n" +
    7007           1 : "void fREe(mem) Void_t* mem;\n" +
    7008           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7009           1 : "{\n" +
    7010           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    7011           1 : "\n" +
    7012           1 : "  mchunkptr       p;           /* chunk corresponding to mem */\n" +
    7013           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T size;        /* its size */\n" +
    7014           1 : "  mfastbinptr*    fb;          /* associated fastbin */\n" +
    7015           1 : "  mchunkptr       nextchunk;   /* next contiguous chunk */\n" +
    7016           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T nextsize;    /* its size */\n" +
    7017           1 : "  int             nextinuse;   /* true if nextchunk is used */\n" +
    7018           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T prevsize;    /* size of previous contiguous chunk */\n" +
    7019           1 : "  mchunkptr       bck;         /* misc temp for linking */\n" +
    7020           1 : "  mchunkptr       fwd;         /* misc temp for linking */\n" +
    7021           1 : "\n" +
    7022           1 : "  /* free(0) has no effect */\n" +
    7023           1 : "  if (mem != 0) {\n" +
    7024           1 : "    p = mem2chunk(mem);\n" +
    7025           1 : "    size = chunksize(p);\n" +
    7026           1 : "\n" +
    7027           1 : "    check_inuse_chunk(p);\n" +
    7028           1 : "\n" +
    7029           1 : "    /*\n" +
    7030           1 : "      If eligible, place chunk on a fastbin so it can be found\n" +
    7031           1 : "      and used quickly in malloc.\n" +
    7032           1 : "    */\n" +
    7033           1 : "\n" +
    7034           1 : "    if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) <= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_fast)\n" +
    7035           1 : "\n" +
    7036           1 : "#if TRIM_FASTBINS\n" +
    7037           1 : "        /*\n" +
    7038           1 : "           If TRIM_FASTBINS set, don't place chunks\n" +
    7039           1 : "           bordering top into fastbins\n" +
    7040           1 : "        */\n" +
    7041           1 : "        && (chunk_at_offset(p, size) != av->top)\n" +
    7042           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7043           1 : "        ) {\n" +
    7044           1 : "\n" +
    7045           1 : "      set_fastchunks(av);\n" +
    7046           1 : "      fb = &(av->fastbins[fastbin_index(size)]);\n" +
    7047           1 : "      p->fd = *fb;\n" +
    7048           1 : "      *fb = p;\n" +
    7049           1 : "    }\n" +
    7050           1 : "\n" +
    7051           1 : "    /*\n" +
    7052           1 : "       Consolidate other non-mmapped chunks as they arrive.\n" +
    7053           1 : "    */\n" +
    7054           1 : "\n" +
    7055           1 : "    else if (!chunk_is_mmapped(p)) {\n" +
    7056           1 : "      set_anychunks(av);\n" +
    7057           1 : "\n" +
    7058           1 : "      nextchunk = chunk_at_offset(p, size);\n" +
    7059           1 : "      nextsize = chunksize(nextchunk);\n" +
    7060           1 : "\n" +
    7061           1 : "      /* consolidate backward */\n" +
    7062           1 : "      if (!prev_inuse(p)) {\n" +
    7063           1 : "        prevsize = p->prev_size;\n" +
    7064           1 : "        size += prevsize;\n" +
    7065           1 : "        p = chunk_at_offset(p, -((long) prevsize));\n" +
    7066           1 : "        unlink(p, bck, fwd);\n" +
    7067           1 : "      }\n" +
    7068           1 : "\n" +
    7069           1 : "      if (nextchunk != av->top) {\n" +
    7070           1 : "        /* get and clear inuse bit */\n" +
    7071           1 : "        nextinuse = inuse_bit_at_offset(nextchunk, nextsize);\n" +
    7072           1 : "        set_head(nextchunk, nextsize);\n" +
    7073           1 : "\n" +
    7074           1 : "        /* consolidate forward */\n" +
    7075           1 : "        if (!nextinuse) {\n" +
    7076           1 : "          unlink(nextchunk, bck, fwd);\n" +
    7077           1 : "          size += nextsize;\n" +
    7078           1 : "        }\n" +
    7079           1 : "\n" +
    7080           1 : "        /*\n" +
    7081           1 : "          Place the chunk in unsorted chunk list. Chunks are\n" +
    7082           1 : "          not placed into regular bins until after they have\n" +
    7083           1 : "          been given one chance to be used in malloc.\n" +
    7084           1 : "        */\n" +
    7085           1 : "\n" +
    7086           1 : "        bck = unsorted_chunks(av);\n" +
    7087           1 : "        fwd = bck->fd;\n" +
    7088           1 : "        p->bk = bck;\n" +
    7089           1 : "        p->fd = fwd;\n" +
    7090           1 : "        bck->fd = p;\n" +
    7091           1 : "        fwd->bk = p;\n" +
    7092           1 : "\n" +
    7093           1 : "        set_head(p, size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7094           1 : "        set_foot(p, size);\n" +
    7095           1 : "\n" +
    7096           1 : "        check_free_chunk(p);\n" +
    7097           1 : "      }\n" +
    7098           1 : "\n" +
    7099           1 : "      /*\n" +
    7100           1 : "         If the chunk borders the current high end of memory,\n" +
    7101           1 : "         consolidate into top\n" +
    7102           1 : "      */\n" +
    7103           1 : "\n" +
    7104           1 : "      else {\n" +
    7105           1 : "        size += nextsize;\n" +
    7106           1 : "        set_head(p, size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7107           1 : "        av->top = p;\n" +
    7108           1 : "        check_chunk(p);\n" +
    7109           1 : "      }\n" +
    7110           1 : "\n" +
    7111           1 : "      /*\n" +
    7112           1 : "        If freeing a large space, consolidate possibly-surrounding\n" +
    7113           1 : "        chunks. Then, if the total unused topmost memory exceeds trim\n" +
    7114           1 : "        threshold, ask malloc_trim to reduce top.\n" +
    7115           1 : "\n" +
    7116           1 : "        Unless max_fast is 0, we don't know if there are fastbins\n" +
    7117           1 : "        bordering top, so we cannot tell for sure whether threshold\n" +
    7118           1 : "        has been reached unless fastbins are consolidated.  But we\n" +
    7119           1 : "        don't want to consolidate on each free.  As a compromise,\n" +
    7120           1 : "        consolidation is performed if FASTBIN_CONSOLIDATION_THRESHOLD\n" +
    7121           1 : "        is reached.\n" +
    7122           1 : "      */\n" +
    7123           1 : "\n" +
    7124           1 : "      if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) >= FASTBIN_CONSOLIDATION_THRESHOLD) {\n" +
    7125           1 : "        if (have_fastchunks(av))\n" +
    7126           1 : "          malloc_consolidate(av);\n" +
    7127           1 : "\n" +
    7128           1 : "#ifndef MORECORE_CANNOT_TRIM\n" +
    7129           1 : "        if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(chunksize(av->top)) >=\n" +
    7130           1 : "            (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->trim_threshold))\n" +
    7131           1 : "          sYSTRIm(av->top_pad, av);\n" +
    7132           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7133           1 : "      }\n" +
    7134           1 : "\n" +
    7135           1 : "    }\n" +
    7136           1 : "    /*\n" +
    7137           1 : "      If the chunk was allocated via mmap, release via munmap()\n" +
    7138           1 : "      Note that if HAVE_MMAP is false but chunk_is_mmapped is\n" +
    7139           1 : "      true, then user must have overwritten memory. There's nothing\n" +
    7140           1 : "      we can do to catch this error unless DEBUG is set, in which case\n" +
    7141           1 : "      check_inuse_chunk (above) will have triggered error.\n" +
    7142           1 : "    */\n" +
    7143           1 : "\n" +
    7144           1 : "    else {\n" +
    7145           1 : "#if HAVE_MMAP\n" +
    7146           1 : "      int ret;\n" +
    7147           1 : "      INTERNAL_SIZE_T offset = p->prev_size;\n" +
    7148           1 : "      av->n_mmaps--;\n" +
    7149           1 : "      av->mmapped_mem -= (size + offset);\n" +
    7150           1 : "      ret = munmap((char*)p - offset, size + offset);\n" +
    7151           1 : "      /* munmap returns non-zero on failure */\n" +
    7152           1 : "      assert(ret == 0);\n" +
    7153           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7154           1 : "    }\n" +
    7155           1 : "  }\n" +
    7156           1 : "}\n" +
    7157           1 : "\n") +
    7158           1 : (
    7159           1 : "/*\n" +
    7160           1 : "  ------------------------- malloc_consolidate -------------------------\n" +
    7161           1 : "\n" +
    7162           1 : "  malloc_consolidate is a specialized version of free() that tears\n" +
    7163           1 : "  down chunks held in fastbins.  Free itself cannot be used for this\n" +
    7164           1 : "  purpose since, among other things, it might place chunks back onto\n" +
    7165           1 : "  fastbins.  So, instead, we need to use a minor variant of the same\n" +
    7166           1 : "  code.\n" +
    7167           1 : "\n" +
    7168           1 : "  Also, because this routine needs to be called the first time through\n" +
    7169           1 : "  malloc anyway, it turns out to be the perfect place to trigger\n" +
    7170           1 : "  initialization code.\n" +
    7171           1 : "*/\n" +
    7172           1 : "\n" +
    7173           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7174           1 : "static void malloc_consolidate(mstate av)\n" +
    7175           1 : "#else\n" +
    7176           1 : "static void malloc_consolidate(av) mstate av;\n" +
    7177           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7178           1 : "{\n" +
    7179           1 : "  mfastbinptr*    fb;                 /* current fastbin being consolidated */\n" +
    7180           1 : "  mfastbinptr*    maxfb;              /* last fastbin (for loop control) */\n" +
    7181           1 : "  mchunkptr       p;                  /* current chunk being consolidated */\n" +
    7182           1 : "  mchunkptr       nextp;              /* next chunk to consolidate */\n" +
    7183           1 : "  mchunkptr       unsorted_bin;       /* bin header */\n" +
    7184           1 : "  mchunkptr       first_unsorted;     /* chunk to link to */\n" +
    7185           1 : "\n" +
    7186           1 : "  /* These have same use as in free() */\n" +
    7187           1 : "  mchunkptr       nextchunk;\n" +
    7188           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T size;\n" +
    7189           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T nextsize;\n" +
    7190           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T prevsize;\n" +
    7191           1 : "  int             nextinuse;\n" +
    7192           1 : "  mchunkptr       bck;\n" +
    7193           1 : "  mchunkptr       fwd;\n" +
    7194           1 : "\n" +
    7195           1 : "  /*\n" +
    7196           1 : "    If max_fast is 0, we know that av hasn't\n" +
    7197           1 : "    yet been initialized, in which case do so below\n" +
    7198           1 : "  */\n" +
    7199           1 : "\n" +
    7200           1 : "  if (av->max_fast != 0) {\n" +
    7201           1 : "    clear_fastchunks(av);\n" +
    7202           1 : "\n" +
    7203           1 : "    unsorted_bin = unsorted_chunks(av);\n" +
    7204           1 : "\n" +
    7205           1 : "    /*\n" +
    7206           1 : "      Remove each chunk from fast bin and consolidate it, placing it\n" +
    7207           1 : "      then in unsorted bin. Among other reasons for doing this,\n" +
    7208           1 : "      placing in unsorted bin avoids needing to calculate actual bins\n" +
    7209           1 : "      until malloc is sure that chunks aren't immediately going to be\n" +
    7210           1 : "      reused anyway.\n" +
    7211           1 : "    */\n" +
    7212           1 : "\n" +
    7213           1 : "    maxfb = &(av->fastbins[fastbin_index(av->max_fast)]);\n" +
    7214           1 : "    fb = &(av->fastbins[0]);\n" +
    7215           1 : "    do {\n" +
    7216           1 : "      if ( (p = *fb) != 0) {\n" +
    7217           1 : "        *fb = 0;\n" +
    7218           1 : "\n" +
    7219           1 : "        do {\n" +
    7220           1 : "          check_inuse_chunk(p);\n" +
    7221           1 : "          nextp = p->fd;\n" +
    7222           1 : "\n" +
    7223           1 : "          /* Slightly streamlined version of consolidation code in free() */\n" +
    7224           1 : "          size = p->size & ~PREV_INUSE;\n" +
    7225           1 : "          nextchunk = chunk_at_offset(p, size);\n" +
    7226           1 : "          nextsize = chunksize(nextchunk);\n" +
    7227           1 : "\n" +
    7228           1 : "          if (!prev_inuse(p)) {\n" +
    7229           1 : "            prevsize = p->prev_size;\n" +
    7230           1 : "            size += prevsize;\n" +
    7231           1 : "            p = chunk_at_offset(p, -((long) prevsize));\n" +
    7232           1 : "            unlink(p, bck, fwd);\n" +
    7233           1 : "          }\n" +
    7234           1 : "\n" +
    7235           1 : "          if (nextchunk != av->top) {\n" +
    7236           1 : "            nextinuse = inuse_bit_at_offset(nextchunk, nextsize);\n" +
    7237           1 : "            set_head(nextchunk, nextsize);\n" +
    7238           1 : "\n" +
    7239           1 : "            if (!nextinuse) {\n" +
    7240           1 : "              size += nextsize;\n" +
    7241           1 : "              unlink(nextchunk, bck, fwd);\n" +
    7242           1 : "            }\n" +
    7243           1 : "\n" +
    7244           1 : "            first_unsorted = unsorted_bin->fd;\n" +
    7245           1 : "            unsorted_bin->fd = p;\n" +
    7246           1 : "            first_unsorted->bk = p;\n" +
    7247           1 : "\n" +
    7248           1 : "            set_head(p, size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7249           1 : "            p->bk = unsorted_bin;\n" +
    7250           1 : "            p->fd = first_unsorted;\n" +
    7251           1 : "            set_foot(p, size);\n" +
    7252           1 : "          }\n" +
    7253           1 : "\n" +
    7254           1 : "          else {\n" +
    7255           1 : "            size += nextsize;\n" +
    7256           1 : "            set_head(p, size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7257           1 : "            av->top = p;\n" +
    7258           1 : "          }\n" +
    7259           1 : "\n" +
    7260           1 : "        } while ( (p = nextp) != 0);\n" +
    7261           1 : "\n" +
    7262           1 : "      }\n" +
    7263           1 : "    } while (fb++ != maxfb);\n" +
    7264           1 : "  }\n" +
    7265           1 : "  else {\n" +
    7266           1 : "    malloc_init_state(av);\n" +
    7267           1 : "    check_malloc_state();\n" +
    7268           1 : "  }\n" +
    7269           1 : "}\n" +
    7270           1 : "\n" +
    7271           1 : "/*\n" +
    7272           1 : "  ------------------------------ realloc ------------------------------\n" +
    7273           1 : "*/\n" +
    7274           1 : "\n" +
    7275           1 : "\n" +
    7276           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7277           1 : "Void_t* rEALLOc(Void_t* oldmem, size_t bytes)\n" +
    7278           1 : "#else\n" +
    7279           1 : "Void_t* rEALLOc(oldmem, bytes) Void_t* oldmem; size_t bytes;\n" +
    7280           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7281           1 : "{\n" +
    7282           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    7283           1 : "\n" +
    7284           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  nb;              /* padded request size */\n" +
    7285           1 : "\n" +
    7286           1 : "  mchunkptr        oldp;            /* chunk corresponding to oldmem */\n" +
    7287           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  oldsize;         /* its size */\n" +
    7288           1 : "\n" +
    7289           1 : "  mchunkptr        newp;            /* chunk to return */\n" +
    7290           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T  newsize;         /* its size */\n" +
    7291           1 : "  Void_t*          newmem;          /* corresponding user mem */\n" +
    7292           1 : "\n" +
    7293           1 : "  mchunkptr        next;            /* next contiguous chunk after oldp */\n" +
    7294           1 : "\n" +
    7295           1 : "  mchunkptr        remainder;       /* extra space at end of newp */\n" +
    7296           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T     remainder_size;  /* its size */\n" +
    7297           1 : "\n" +
    7298           1 : "  mchunkptr        bck;             /* misc temp for linking */\n" +
    7299           1 : "  mchunkptr        fwd;             /* misc temp for linking */\n" +
    7300           1 : "\n" +
    7301           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T     copysize;        /* bytes to copy */\n" +
    7302           1 : "  unsigned int     ncopies;         /* INTERNAL_SIZE_T words to copy */\n" +
    7303           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T* s;               /* copy source */\n" +
    7304           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T* d;               /* copy destination */\n" +
    7305           1 : "\n" +
    7306           1 : "\n" +
    7307           1 : "#ifdef REALLOC_ZERO_BYTES_FREES\n" +
    7308           1 : "  if (bytes == 0) {\n" +
    7309           1 : "    fREe(oldmem);\n" +
    7310           1 : "    return 0;\n" +
    7311           1 : "  }\n" +
    7312           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7313           1 : "\n") +
    7314           1 : (
    7315           1 : "  /* realloc of null is supposed to be same as malloc */\n" +
    7316           1 : "  if (oldmem == 0) return mALLOc(bytes);\n" +
    7317           1 : "\n" +
    7318           1 : "  checked_request2size(bytes, nb);\n" +
    7319           1 : "\n" +
    7320           1 : "  oldp    = mem2chunk(oldmem);\n" +
    7321           1 : "  oldsize = chunksize(oldp);\n" +
    7322           1 : "\n" +
    7323           1 : "  check_inuse_chunk(oldp);\n" +
    7324           1 : "\n" +
    7325           1 : "  if (!chunk_is_mmapped(oldp)) {\n" +
    7326           1 : "\n" +
    7327           1 : "    if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(oldsize) >= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb)) {\n" +
    7328           1 : "      /* already big enough; split below */\n" +
    7329           1 : "      newp = oldp;\n" +
    7330           1 : "      newsize = oldsize;\n" +
    7331           1 : "    }\n" +
    7332           1 : "\n" +
    7333           1 : "    else {\n" +
    7334           1 : "      next = chunk_at_offset(oldp, oldsize);\n" +
    7335           1 : "\n" +
    7336           1 : "      /* Try to expand forward into top */\n" +
    7337           1 : "      if (next == av->top &&\n" +
    7338           1 : "          (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(newsize = oldsize + chunksize(next)) >=\n" +
    7339           1 : "          (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb + MINSIZE)) {\n" +
    7340           1 : "        set_head_size(oldp, nb);\n" +
    7341           1 : "        av->top = chunk_at_offset(oldp, nb);\n" +
    7342           1 : "        set_head(av->top, (newsize - nb) | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7343           1 : "        return chunk2mem(oldp);\n" +
    7344           1 : "      }\n" +
    7345           1 : "\n" +
    7346           1 : "      /* Try to expand forward into next chunk;  split off remainder below */\n" +
    7347           1 : "      else if (next != av->top &&\n" +
    7348           1 : "               !inuse(next) &&\n" +
    7349           1 : "               (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(newsize = oldsize + chunksize(next)) >=\n" +
    7350           1 : "               (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb)) {\n" +
    7351           1 : "        newp = oldp;\n" +
    7352           1 : "        unlink(next, bck, fwd);\n" +
    7353           1 : "      }\n" +
    7354           1 : "\n" +
    7355           1 : "      /* allocate, copy, free */\n" +
    7356           1 : "      else {\n" +
    7357           1 : "        newmem = mALLOc(nb - MALLOC_ALIGN_MASK);\n" +
    7358           1 : "        if (newmem == 0)\n" +
    7359           1 : "          return 0; /* propagate failure */\n" +
    7360           1 : "\n" +
    7361           1 : "        newp = mem2chunk(newmem);\n" +
    7362           1 : "        newsize = chunksize(newp);\n" +
    7363           1 : "\n" +
    7364           1 : "        /*\n" +
    7365           1 : "          Avoid copy if newp is next chunk after oldp.\n" +
    7366           1 : "        */\n" +
    7367           1 : "        if (newp == next) {\n" +
    7368           1 : "          newsize += oldsize;\n" +
    7369           1 : "          newp = oldp;\n" +
    7370           1 : "        }\n" +
    7371           1 : "        else {\n" +
    7372           1 : "          /*\n" +
    7373           1 : "            Unroll copy of <= 36 bytes (72 if 8byte sizes)\n" +
    7374           1 : "            We know that contents have an odd number of\n" +
    7375           1 : "            INTERNAL_SIZE_T-sized words; minimally 3.\n" +
    7376           1 : "          */\n" +
    7377           1 : "\n" +
    7378           1 : "          copysize = oldsize - SIZE_SZ;\n" +
    7379           1 : "          s = (INTERNAL_SIZE_T*)(oldmem);\n" +
    7380           1 : "          d = (INTERNAL_SIZE_T*)(newmem);\n" +
    7381           1 : "          ncopies = copysize / sizeof(INTERNAL_SIZE_T);\n" +
    7382           1 : "          assert(ncopies >= 3);\n" +
    7383           1 : "\n" +
    7384           1 : "          if (ncopies > 9)\n" +
    7385           1 : "            MALLOC_COPY(d, s, copysize);\n" +
    7386           1 : "\n" +
    7387           1 : "          else {\n" +
    7388           1 : "            *(d+0) = *(s+0);\n" +
    7389           1 : "            *(d+1) = *(s+1);\n" +
    7390           1 : "            *(d+2) = *(s+2);\n" +
    7391           1 : "            if (ncopies > 4) {\n" +
    7392           1 : "              *(d+3) = *(s+3);\n" +
    7393           1 : "              *(d+4) = *(s+4);\n" +
    7394           1 : "              if (ncopies > 6) {\n" +
    7395           1 : "                *(d+5) = *(s+5);\n" +
    7396           1 : "                *(d+6) = *(s+6);\n" +
    7397           1 : "                if (ncopies > 8) {\n" +
    7398           1 : "                  *(d+7) = *(s+7);\n" +
    7399           1 : "                  *(d+8) = *(s+8);\n" +
    7400           1 : "                }\n" +
    7401           1 : "              }\n" +
    7402           1 : "            }\n" +
    7403           1 : "          }\n" +
    7404           1 : "\n" +
    7405           1 : "          fREe(oldmem);\n" +
    7406           1 : "          check_inuse_chunk(newp);\n" +
    7407           1 : "          return chunk2mem(newp);\n" +
    7408           1 : "        }\n" +
    7409           1 : "      }\n" +
    7410           1 : "    }\n" +
    7411           1 : "\n" +
    7412           1 : "    /* If possible, free extra space in old or extended chunk */\n" +
    7413           1 : "\n" +
    7414           1 : "    assert((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(newsize) >= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb));\n" +
    7415           1 : "\n" +
    7416           1 : "    remainder_size = newsize - nb;\n" +
    7417           1 : "\n" +
    7418           1 : "    if (remainder_size < MINSIZE) { /* not enough extra to split off */\n" +
    7419           1 : "      set_head_size(newp, newsize);\n" +
    7420           1 : "      set_inuse_bit_at_offset(newp, newsize);\n" +
    7421           1 : "    }\n" +
    7422           1 : "    else { /* split remainder */\n" +
    7423           1 : "      remainder = chunk_at_offset(newp, nb);\n" +
    7424           1 : "      set_head_size(newp, nb);\n" +
    7425           1 : "      set_head(remainder, remainder_size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7426           1 : "      /* Mark remainder as inuse so free() won't complain */\n" +
    7427           1 : "      set_inuse_bit_at_offset(remainder, remainder_size);\n" +
    7428           1 : "      fREe(chunk2mem(remainder));\n" +
    7429           1 : "    }\n" +
    7430           1 : "\n" +
    7431           1 : "    check_inuse_chunk(newp);\n" +
    7432           1 : "    return chunk2mem(newp);\n" +
    7433           1 : "  }\n" +
    7434           1 : "\n" +
    7435           1 : "  /*\n" +
    7436           1 : "    Handle mmap cases\n" +
    7437           1 : "  */\n" +
    7438           1 : "\n" +
    7439           1 : "  else {\n" +
    7440           1 : "#if HAVE_MMAP\n" +
    7441           1 : "\n" +
    7442           1 : "#if HAVE_MREMAP\n" +
    7443           1 : "    INTERNAL_SIZE_T offset = oldp->prev_size;\n" +
    7444           1 : "    size_t pagemask = av->pagesize - 1;\n" +
    7445           1 : "    char *cp;\n" +
    7446           1 : "    CHUNK_SIZE_T  sum;\n" +
    7447           1 : "\n" +
    7448           1 : "    /* Note the extra SIZE_SZ overhead */\n" +
    7449           1 : "    newsize = (nb + offset + SIZE_SZ + pagemask) & ~pagemask;\n" +
    7450           1 : "\n" +
    7451           1 : "    /* don't need to remap if still within same page */\n" +
    7452           1 : "    if (oldsize == newsize - offset)\n" +
    7453           1 : "      return oldmem;\n" +
    7454           1 : "\n" +
    7455           1 : "    cp = (char*)mremap((char*)oldp - offset, oldsize + offset, newsize, 1);\n" +
    7456           1 : "\n" +
    7457           1 : "    if (cp != (char*)MORECORE_FAILURE) {\n" +
    7458           1 : "\n" +
    7459           1 : "      newp = (mchunkptr)(cp + offset);\n" +
    7460           1 : "      set_head(newp, (newsize - offset)|IS_MMAPPED);\n" +
    7461           1 : "\n" +
    7462           1 : "      assert(aligned_OK(chunk2mem(newp)));\n" +
    7463           1 : "      assert((newp->prev_size == offset));\n" +
    7464           1 : "\n") +
    7465           1 : (
    7466           1 : "      /* update statistics */\n" +
    7467           1 : "      sum = av->mmapped_mem += newsize - oldsize;\n" +
    7468           1 : "      if (sum > (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_mmapped_mem))\n" +
    7469           1 : "        av->max_mmapped_mem = sum;\n" +
    7470           1 : "      sum += av->sbrked_mem;\n" +
    7471           1 : "      if (sum > (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(av->max_total_mem))\n" +
    7472           1 : "        av->max_total_mem = sum;\n" +
    7473           1 : "\n" +
    7474           1 : "      return chunk2mem(newp);\n" +
    7475           1 : "    }\n" +
    7476           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7477           1 : "\n" +
    7478           1 : "    /* Note the extra SIZE_SZ overhead. */\n" +
    7479           1 : "    if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(oldsize) >= (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb + SIZE_SZ))\n" +
    7480           1 : "      newmem = oldmem; /* do nothing */\n" +
    7481           1 : "    else {\n" +
    7482           1 : "      /* Must alloc, copy, free. */\n" +
    7483           1 : "      newmem = mALLOc(nb - MALLOC_ALIGN_MASK);\n" +
    7484           1 : "      if (newmem != 0) {\n" +
    7485           1 : "        MALLOC_COPY(newmem, oldmem, oldsize - 2*SIZE_SZ);\n" +
    7486           1 : "        fREe(oldmem);\n" +
    7487           1 : "      }\n" +
    7488           1 : "    }\n" +
    7489           1 : "    return newmem;\n" +
    7490           1 : "\n" +
    7491           1 : "#else\n" +
    7492           1 : "    /* If !HAVE_MMAP, but chunk_is_mmapped, user must have overwritten mem */\n" +
    7493           1 : "    check_malloc_state();\n" +
    7494           1 : "    MALLOC_FAILURE_ACTION;\n" +
    7495           1 : "    return 0;\n" +
    7496           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7497           1 : "  }\n" +
    7498           1 : "}\n" +
    7499           1 : "\n" +
    7500           1 : "/*\n" +
    7501           1 : "  ------------------------------ memalign ------------------------------\n" +
    7502           1 : "*/\n" +
    7503           1 : "\n" +
    7504           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7505           1 : "Void_t* mEMALIGn(size_t alignment, size_t bytes)\n" +
    7506           1 : "#else\n" +
    7507           1 : "Void_t* mEMALIGn(alignment, bytes) size_t alignment; size_t bytes;\n" +
    7508           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7509           1 : "{\n" +
    7510           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T nb;             /* padded  request size */\n" +
    7511           1 : "  char*           m;              /* memory returned by malloc call */\n" +
    7512           1 : "  mchunkptr       p;              /* corresponding chunk */\n" +
    7513           1 : "  char*           brk;            /* alignment point within p */\n" +
    7514           1 : "  mchunkptr       newp;           /* chunk to return */\n" +
    7515           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T newsize;        /* its size */\n" +
    7516           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T leadsize;       /* leading space before alignment point */\n" +
    7517           1 : "  mchunkptr       remainder;      /* spare room at end to split off */\n" +
    7518           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T    remainder_size; /* its size */\n" +
    7519           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T size;\n" +
    7520           1 : "\n" +
    7521           1 : "  /* If need less alignment than we give anyway, just relay to malloc */\n" +
    7522           1 : "\n" +
    7523           1 : "  if (alignment <= MALLOC_ALIGNMENT) return mALLOc(bytes);\n" +
    7524           1 : "\n" +
    7525           1 : "  /* Otherwise, ensure that it is at least a minimum chunk size */\n" +
    7526           1 : "\n" +
    7527           1 : "  if (alignment <  MINSIZE) alignment = MINSIZE;\n" +
    7528           1 : "\n" +
    7529           1 : "  /* Make sure alignment is power of 2 (in case MINSIZE is not).  */\n" +
    7530           1 : "  if ((alignment & (alignment - 1)) != 0) {\n" +
    7531           1 : "    size_t a = MALLOC_ALIGNMENT * 2;\n" +
    7532           1 : "    while ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)a < (CHUNK_SIZE_T)alignment) a <<= 1;\n" +
    7533           1 : "    alignment = a;\n" +
    7534           1 : "  }\n" +
    7535           1 : "\n" +
    7536           1 : "  checked_request2size(bytes, nb);\n" +
    7537           1 : "\n" +
    7538           1 : "  /*\n" +
    7539           1 : "    Strategy: find a spot within that chunk that meets the alignment\n" +
    7540           1 : "    request, and then possibly free the leading and trailing space.\n" +
    7541           1 : "  */\n" +
    7542           1 : "\n" +
    7543           1 : "\n" +
    7544           1 : "  /* Call malloc with worst case padding to hit alignment. */\n" +
    7545           1 : "\n" +
    7546           1 : "  m  = (char*)(mALLOc(nb + alignment + MINSIZE));\n" +
    7547           1 : "\n" +
    7548           1 : "  if (m == 0) return 0; /* propagate failure */\n" +
    7549           1 : "\n" +
    7550           1 : "  p = mem2chunk(m);\n" +
    7551           1 : "\n" +
    7552           1 : "  if ((((PTR_UINT)(m)) % alignment) != 0) { /* misaligned */\n" +
    7553           1 : "\n" +
    7554           1 : "    /*\n" +
    7555           1 : "      Find an aligned spot inside chunk.  Since we need to give back\n" +
    7556           1 : "      leading space in a chunk of at least MINSIZE, if the first\n" +
    7557           1 : "      calculation places us at a spot with less than MINSIZE leader,\n" +
    7558           1 : "      we can move to the next aligned spot -- we've allocated enough\n" +
    7559           1 : "      total room so that this is always possible.\n" +
    7560           1 : "    */\n" +
    7561           1 : "\n" +
    7562           1 : "    brk = (char*)mem2chunk((PTR_UINT)(((PTR_UINT)(m + alignment - 1)) &\n" +
    7563           1 : "                           -((signed long) alignment)));\n" +
    7564           1 : "    if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(brk - (char*)(p)) < MINSIZE)\n" +
    7565           1 : "      brk += alignment;\n" +
    7566           1 : "\n" +
    7567           1 : "    newp = (mchunkptr)brk;\n" +
    7568           1 : "    leadsize = brk - (char*)(p);\n" +
    7569           1 : "    newsize = chunksize(p) - leadsize;\n" +
    7570           1 : "\n" +
    7571           1 : "    /* For mmapped chunks, just adjust offset */\n" +
    7572           1 : "    if (chunk_is_mmapped(p)) {\n" +
    7573           1 : "      newp->prev_size = p->prev_size + leadsize;\n" +
    7574           1 : "      set_head(newp, newsize|IS_MMAPPED);\n" +
    7575           1 : "      return chunk2mem(newp);\n" +
    7576           1 : "    }\n" +
    7577           1 : "\n" +
    7578           1 : "    /* Otherwise, give back leader, use the rest */\n" +
    7579           1 : "    set_head(newp, newsize | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7580           1 : "    set_inuse_bit_at_offset(newp, newsize);\n" +
    7581           1 : "    set_head_size(p, leadsize);\n" +
    7582           1 : "    fREe(chunk2mem(p));\n" +
    7583           1 : "    p = newp;\n" +
    7584           1 : "\n" +
    7585           1 : "    assert (newsize >= nb &&\n" +
    7586           1 : "            (((PTR_UINT)(chunk2mem(p))) % alignment) == 0);\n" +
    7587           1 : "  }\n" +
    7588           1 : "\n" +
    7589           1 : "  /* Also give back spare room at the end */\n" +
    7590           1 : "  if (!chunk_is_mmapped(p)) {\n" +
    7591           1 : "    size = chunksize(p);\n" +
    7592           1 : "    if ((CHUNK_SIZE_T)(size) > (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(nb + MINSIZE)) {\n" +
    7593           1 : "      remainder_size = size - nb;\n" +
    7594           1 : "      remainder = chunk_at_offset(p, nb);\n" +
    7595           1 : "      set_head(remainder, remainder_size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7596           1 : "      set_head_size(p, nb);\n" +
    7597           1 : "      fREe(chunk2mem(remainder));\n" +
    7598           1 : "    }\n" +
    7599           1 : "  }\n" +
    7600           1 : "\n" +
    7601           1 : "  check_inuse_chunk(p);\n" +
    7602           1 : "  return chunk2mem(p);\n" +
    7603           1 : "}\n" +
    7604           1 : "\n" +
    7605           1 : "/*\n" +
    7606           1 : "  ------------------------------ calloc ------------------------------\n" +
    7607           1 : "*/\n" +
    7608           1 : "\n" +
    7609           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7610           1 : "Void_t* cALLOc(size_t n_elements, size_t elem_size)\n" +
    7611           1 : "#else\n" +
    7612           1 : "Void_t* cALLOc(n_elements, elem_size) size_t n_elements; size_t elem_size;\n" +
    7613           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7614           1 : "{\n" +
    7615           1 : "  mchunkptr p;\n" +
    7616           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T  clearsize;\n" +
    7617           1 : "  CHUNK_SIZE_T  nclears;\n" +
    7618           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T* d;\n" +
    7619           1 : "\n") +
    7620           1 : (
    7621           1 : "  Void_t* mem = mALLOc(n_elements * elem_size);\n" +
    7622           1 : "\n" +
    7623           1 : "  if (mem != 0) {\n" +
    7624           1 : "    p = mem2chunk(mem);\n" +
    7625           1 : "\n" +
    7626           1 : "    if (!chunk_is_mmapped(p))\n" +
    7627           1 : "    {\n" +
    7628           1 : "      /*\n" +
    7629           1 : "        Unroll clear of <= 36 bytes (72 if 8byte sizes)\n" +
    7630           1 : "        We know that contents have an odd number of\n" +
    7631           1 : "        INTERNAL_SIZE_T-sized words; minimally 3.\n" +
    7632           1 : "      */\n" +
    7633           1 : "\n" +
    7634           1 : "      d = (INTERNAL_SIZE_T*)mem;\n" +
    7635           1 : "      clearsize = chunksize(p) - SIZE_SZ;\n" +
    7636           1 : "      nclears = clearsize / sizeof(INTERNAL_SIZE_T);\n" +
    7637           1 : "      assert(nclears >= 3);\n" +
    7638           1 : "\n" +
    7639           1 : "      if (nclears > 9)\n" +
    7640           1 : "        MALLOC_ZERO(d, clearsize);\n" +
    7641           1 : "\n" +
    7642           1 : "      else {\n" +
    7643           1 : "        *(d+0) = 0;\n" +
    7644           1 : "        *(d+1) = 0;\n" +
    7645           1 : "        *(d+2) = 0;\n" +
    7646           1 : "        if (nclears > 4) {\n" +
    7647           1 : "          *(d+3) = 0;\n" +
    7648           1 : "          *(d+4) = 0;\n" +
    7649           1 : "          if (nclears > 6) {\n" +
    7650           1 : "            *(d+5) = 0;\n" +
    7651           1 : "            *(d+6) = 0;\n" +
    7652           1 : "            if (nclears > 8) {\n" +
    7653           1 : "              *(d+7) = 0;\n" +
    7654           1 : "              *(d+8) = 0;\n" +
    7655           1 : "            }\n" +
    7656           1 : "          }\n" +
    7657           1 : "        }\n" +
    7658           1 : "      }\n" +
    7659           1 : "    }\n" +
    7660           1 : "#if ! MMAP_CLEARS\n" +
    7661           1 : "    else\n" +
    7662           1 : "    {\n" +
    7663           1 : "      d = (INTERNAL_SIZE_T*)mem;\n" +
    7664           1 : "      /*\n" +
    7665           1 : "        Note the additional SIZE_SZ\n" +
    7666           1 : "      */\n" +
    7667           1 : "      clearsize = chunksize(p) - 2*SIZE_SZ;\n" +
    7668           1 : "      MALLOC_ZERO(d, clearsize);\n" +
    7669           1 : "    }\n" +
    7670           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7671           1 : "  }\n" +
    7672           1 : "  return mem;\n" +
    7673           1 : "}\n" +
    7674           1 : "\n" +
    7675           1 : "/*\n" +
    7676           1 : "  ------------------------------ cfree ------------------------------\n" +
    7677           1 : "*/\n" +
    7678           1 : "\n" +
    7679           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7680           1 : "void cFREe(Void_t *mem)\n" +
    7681           1 : "#else\n" +
    7682           1 : "void cFREe(mem) Void_t *mem;\n" +
    7683           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7684           1 : "{\n" +
    7685           1 : "  fREe(mem);\n" +
    7686           1 : "}\n" +
    7687           1 : "\n" +
    7688           1 : "/*\n" +
    7689           1 : "  ------------------------- independent_calloc -------------------------\n" +
    7690           1 : "*/\n" +
    7691           1 : "\n" +
    7692           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7693           1 : "Void_t** iCALLOc(size_t n_elements, size_t elem_size, Void_t* chunks[])\n" +
    7694           1 : "#else\n" +
    7695           1 : "Void_t** iCALLOc(n_elements, elem_size, chunks) size_t n_elements; size_t elem_size; Void_t* chunks[];\n" +
    7696           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7697           1 : "{\n" +
    7698           1 : "  size_t sz = elem_size; /* serves as 1-element array */\n" +
    7699           1 : "  /* opts arg of 3 means all elements are same size, and should be cleared */\n" +
    7700           1 : "  return iALLOc(n_elements, &sz, 3, chunks);\n" +
    7701           1 : "}\n" +
    7702           1 : "\n" +
    7703           1 : "/*\n" +
    7704           1 : "  ------------------------- independent_comalloc -------------------------\n" +
    7705           1 : "*/\n" +
    7706           1 : "\n" +
    7707           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7708           1 : "Void_t** iCOMALLOc(size_t n_elements, size_t sizes[], Void_t* chunks[])\n" +
    7709           1 : "#else\n" +
    7710           1 : "Void_t** iCOMALLOc(n_elements, sizes, chunks) size_t n_elements; size_t sizes[]; Void_t* chunks[];\n" +
    7711           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7712           1 : "{\n" +
    7713           1 : "  return iALLOc(n_elements, sizes, 0, chunks);\n" +
    7714           1 : "}\n" +
    7715           1 : "\n" +
    7716           1 : "\n" +
    7717           1 : "/*\n" +
    7718           1 : "  ------------------------------ ialloc ------------------------------\n" +
    7719           1 : "  ialloc provides common support for independent_X routines, handling all of\n" +
    7720           1 : "  the combinations that can result.\n" +
    7721           1 : "\n" +
    7722           1 : "  The opts arg has:\n" +
    7723           1 : "    bit 0 set if all elements are same size (using sizes[0])\n" +
    7724           1 : "    bit 1 set if elements should be zeroed\n" +
    7725           1 : "*/\n" +
    7726           1 : "\n" +
    7727           1 : "\n" +
    7728           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7729           1 : "static Void_t** iALLOc(size_t n_elements,\n" +
    7730           1 : "                       size_t* sizes,\n" +
    7731           1 : "                       int opts,\n" +
    7732           1 : "                       Void_t* chunks[])\n" +
    7733           1 : "#else\n" +
    7734           1 : "static Void_t** iALLOc(n_elements, sizes, opts, chunks) size_t n_elements; size_t* sizes; int opts; Void_t* chunks[];\n" +
    7735           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7736           1 : "{\n" +
    7737           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    7738           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T element_size;   /* chunksize of each element, if all same */\n" +
    7739           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T contents_size;  /* total size of elements */\n" +
    7740           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T array_size;     /* request size of pointer array */\n" +
    7741           1 : "  Void_t*         mem;            /* malloced aggregate space */\n" +
    7742           1 : "  mchunkptr       p;              /* corresponding chunk */\n" +
    7743           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T remainder_size; /* remaining bytes while splitting */\n" +
    7744           1 : "  Void_t**        marray;         /* either \"chunks\" or malloced ptr array */\n" +
    7745           1 : "  mchunkptr       array_chunk;    /* chunk for malloced ptr array */\n" +
    7746           1 : "  int             mmx;            /* to disable mmap */\n" +
    7747           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T size;\n" +
    7748           1 : "  size_t          i;\n" +
    7749           1 : "\n" +
    7750           1 : "  /* Ensure initialization */\n" +
    7751           1 : "  if (av->max_fast == 0) malloc_consolidate(av);\n" +
    7752           1 : "\n" +
    7753           1 : "  /* compute array length, if needed */\n" +
    7754           1 : "  if (chunks != 0) {\n" +
    7755           1 : "    if (n_elements == 0)\n" +
    7756           1 : "      return chunks; /* nothing to do */\n" +
    7757           1 : "    marray = chunks;\n" +
    7758           1 : "    array_size = 0;\n" +
    7759           1 : "  }\n" +
    7760           1 : "  else {\n" +
    7761           1 : "    /* if empty req, must still return chunk representing empty array */\n" +
    7762           1 : "    if (n_elements == 0)\n" +
    7763           1 : "      return (Void_t**) mALLOc(0);\n" +
    7764           1 : "    marray = 0;\n" +
    7765           1 : "    array_size = request2size(n_elements * (sizeof(Void_t*)));\n" +
    7766           1 : "  }\n" +
    7767           1 : "\n" +
    7768           1 : "  /* compute total element size */\n" +
    7769           1 : "  if (opts & 0x1) { /* all-same-size */\n" +
    7770           1 : "    element_size = request2size(*sizes);\n" +
    7771           1 : "    contents_size = n_elements * element_size;\n" +
    7772           1 : "  }\n" +
    7773           1 : "  else { /* add up all the sizes */\n" +
    7774           1 : "    element_size = 0;\n" +
    7775           1 : "    contents_size = 0;\n" +
    7776           1 : "    for (i = 0; i != n_elements; ++i)\n" +
    7777           1 : "      contents_size += request2size(sizes[i]);\n" +
    7778           1 : "  }\n" +
    7779           1 : "\n") +
    7780           1 : (
    7781           1 : "  /* subtract out alignment bytes from total to minimize overallocation */\n" +
    7782           1 : "  size = contents_size + array_size - MALLOC_ALIGN_MASK;\n" +
    7783           1 : "\n" +
    7784           1 : "  /*\n" +
    7785           1 : "     Allocate the aggregate chunk.\n" +
    7786           1 : "     But first disable mmap so malloc won't use it, since\n" +
    7787           1 : "     we would not be able to later free/realloc space internal\n" +
    7788           1 : "     to a segregated mmap region.\n" +
    7789           1 : " */\n" +
    7790           1 : "  mmx = av->n_mmaps_max;   /* disable mmap */\n" +
    7791           1 : "  av->n_mmaps_max = 0;\n" +
    7792           1 : "  mem = mALLOc(size);\n" +
    7793           1 : "  av->n_mmaps_max = mmx;   /* reset mmap */\n" +
    7794           1 : "  if (mem == 0)\n" +
    7795           1 : "    return 0;\n" +
    7796           1 : "\n" +
    7797           1 : "  p = mem2chunk(mem);\n" +
    7798           1 : "  assert(!chunk_is_mmapped(p));\n" +
    7799           1 : "  remainder_size = chunksize(p);\n" +
    7800           1 : "\n" +
    7801           1 : "  if (opts & 0x2) {       /* optionally clear the elements */\n" +
    7802           1 : "    MALLOC_ZERO(mem, remainder_size - SIZE_SZ - array_size);\n" +
    7803           1 : "  }\n" +
    7804           1 : "\n" +
    7805           1 : "  /* If not provided, allocate the pointer array as final part of chunk */\n" +
    7806           1 : "  if (marray == 0) {\n" +
    7807           1 : "    array_chunk = chunk_at_offset(p, contents_size);\n" +
    7808           1 : "    marray = (Void_t**) (chunk2mem(array_chunk));\n" +
    7809           1 : "    set_head(array_chunk, (remainder_size - contents_size) | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7810           1 : "    remainder_size = contents_size;\n" +
    7811           1 : "  }\n" +
    7812           1 : "\n" +
    7813           1 : "  /* split out elements */\n" +
    7814           1 : "  for (i = 0; ; ++i) {\n" +
    7815           1 : "    marray[i] = chunk2mem(p);\n" +
    7816           1 : "    if (i != n_elements-1) {\n" +
    7817           1 : "      if (element_size != 0)\n" +
    7818           1 : "        size = element_size;\n" +
    7819           1 : "      else\n" +
    7820           1 : "        size = request2size(sizes[i]);\n" +
    7821           1 : "      remainder_size -= size;\n" +
    7822           1 : "      set_head(p, size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7823           1 : "      p = chunk_at_offset(p, size);\n" +
    7824           1 : "    }\n" +
    7825           1 : "    else { /* the final element absorbs any overallocation slop */\n" +
    7826           1 : "      set_head(p, remainder_size | PREV_INUSE);\n" +
    7827           1 : "      break;\n" +
    7828           1 : "    }\n" +
    7829           1 : "  }\n" +
    7830           1 : "\n" +
    7831           1 : "#if DEBUG\n" +
    7832           1 : "  if (marray != chunks) {\n" +
    7833           1 : "    /* final element must have exactly exhausted chunk */\n" +
    7834           1 : "    if (element_size != 0)\n" +
    7835           1 : "      assert(remainder_size == element_size);\n" +
    7836           1 : "    else\n" +
    7837           1 : "      assert(remainder_size == request2size(sizes[i]));\n" +
    7838           1 : "    check_inuse_chunk(mem2chunk(marray));\n" +
    7839           1 : "  }\n" +
    7840           1 : "\n" +
    7841           1 : "  for (i = 0; i != n_elements; ++i)\n" +
    7842           1 : "    check_inuse_chunk(mem2chunk(marray[i]));\n" +
    7843           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7844           1 : "\n" +
    7845           1 : "  return marray;\n" +
    7846           1 : "}\n" +
    7847           1 : "\n" +
    7848           1 : "\n" +
    7849           1 : "/*\n" +
    7850           1 : "  ------------------------------ valloc ------------------------------\n" +
    7851           1 : "*/\n" +
    7852           1 : "\n" +
    7853           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7854           1 : "Void_t* vALLOc(size_t bytes)\n" +
    7855           1 : "#else\n" +
    7856           1 : "Void_t* vALLOc(bytes) size_t bytes;\n" +
    7857           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7858           1 : "{\n" +
    7859           1 : "  /* Ensure initialization */\n" +
    7860           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    7861           1 : "  if (av->max_fast == 0) malloc_consolidate(av);\n" +
    7862           1 : "  return mEMALIGn(av->pagesize, bytes);\n" +
    7863           1 : "}\n" +
    7864           1 : "\n" +
    7865           1 : "/*\n" +
    7866           1 : "  ------------------------------ pvalloc ------------------------------\n" +
    7867           1 : "*/\n" +
    7868           1 : "\n" +
    7869           1 : "\n" +
    7870           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7871           1 : "Void_t* pVALLOc(size_t bytes)\n" +
    7872           1 : "#else\n" +
    7873           1 : "Void_t* pVALLOc(bytes) size_t bytes;\n" +
    7874           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7875           1 : "{\n" +
    7876           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    7877           1 : "  size_t pagesz;\n" +
    7878           1 : "\n" +
    7879           1 : "  /* Ensure initialization */\n" +
    7880           1 : "  if (av->max_fast == 0) malloc_consolidate(av);\n" +
    7881           1 : "  pagesz = av->pagesize;\n" +
    7882           1 : "  return mEMALIGn(pagesz, (bytes + pagesz - 1) & ~(pagesz - 1));\n" +
    7883           1 : "}\n" +
    7884           1 : "\n" +
    7885           1 : "\n" +
    7886           1 : "/*\n" +
    7887           1 : "  ------------------------------ malloc_trim ------------------------------\n" +
    7888           1 : "*/\n" +
    7889           1 : "\n" +
    7890           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7891           1 : "int mTRIm(size_t pad)\n" +
    7892           1 : "#else\n" +
    7893           1 : "int mTRIm(pad) size_t pad;\n" +
    7894           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7895           1 : "{\n" +
    7896           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    7897           1 : "  /* Ensure initialization/consolidation */\n" +
    7898           1 : "  malloc_consolidate(av);\n" +
    7899           1 : "\n" +
    7900           1 : "#ifndef MORECORE_CANNOT_TRIM\n" +
    7901           1 : "  return sYSTRIm(pad, av);\n" +
    7902           1 : "#else\n" +
    7903           1 : "  return 0;\n" +
    7904           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7905           1 : "}\n" +
    7906           1 : "\n" +
    7907           1 : "\n" +
    7908           1 : "/*\n" +
    7909           1 : "  ------------------------- malloc_usable_size -------------------------\n" +
    7910           1 : "*/\n" +
    7911           1 : "\n" +
    7912           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    7913           1 : "size_t mUSABLe(Void_t* mem)\n" +
    7914           1 : "#else\n" +
    7915           1 : "size_t mUSABLe(mem) Void_t* mem;\n" +
    7916           1 : "#endif\n" +
    7917           1 : "{\n" +
    7918           1 : "  mchunkptr p;\n" +
    7919           1 : "  if (mem != 0) {\n" +
    7920           1 : "    p = mem2chunk(mem);\n" +
    7921           1 : "    if (chunk_is_mmapped(p))\n" +
    7922           1 : "      return chunksize(p) - 2*SIZE_SZ;\n" +
    7923           1 : "    else if (inuse(p))\n" +
    7924           1 : "      return chunksize(p) - SIZE_SZ;\n" +
    7925           1 : "  }\n" +
    7926           1 : "  return 0;\n" +
    7927           1 : "}\n" +
    7928           1 : "\n" +
    7929           1 : "/*\n" +
    7930           1 : "  ------------------------------ mallinfo ------------------------------\n" +
    7931           1 : "*/\n" +
    7932           1 : "\n") +
    7933           1 : (
    7934           1 : "struct mallinfo mALLINFo()\n" +
    7935           1 : "{\n" +
    7936           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    7937           1 : "  struct mallinfo mi;\n" +
    7938           1 : "  unsigned int i;\n" +
    7939           1 : "  mbinptr b;\n" +
    7940           1 : "  mchunkptr p;\n" +
    7941           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T avail;\n" +
    7942           1 : "  INTERNAL_SIZE_T fastavail;\n" +
    7943           1 : "  int nblocks;\n" +
    7944           1 : "  int nfastblocks;\n" +
    7945           1 : "\n" +
    7946           1 : "  /* Ensure initialization */\n" +
    7947           1 : "  if (av->top == 0)  malloc_consolidate(av);\n" +
    7948           1 : "\n" +
    7949           1 : "  check_malloc_state();\n" +
    7950           1 : "\n" +
    7951           1 : "  /* Account for top */\n" +
    7952           1 : "  avail = chunksize(av->top);\n" +
    7953           1 : "  nblocks = 1;  /* top always exists */\n" +
    7954           1 : "\n" +
    7955           1 : "  /* traverse fastbins */\n" +
    7956           1 : "  nfastblocks = 0;\n" +
    7957           1 : "  fastavail = 0;\n" +
    7958           1 : "\n" +
    7959           1 : "  for (i = 0; i < NFASTBINS; ++i) {\n" +
    7960           1 : "    for (p = av->fastbins[i]; p != 0; p = p->fd) {\n" +
    7961           1 : "      ++nfastblocks;\n" +
    7962           1 : "      fastavail += chunksize(p);\n" +
    7963           1 : "    }\n" +
    7964           1 : "  }\n" +
    7965           1 : "\n" +
    7966           1 : "  avail += fastavail;\n" +
    7967           1 : "\n" +
    7968           1 : "  /* traverse regular bins */\n" +
    7969           1 : "  for (i = 1; i < NBINS; ++i) {\n" +
    7970           1 : "    b = bin_at(av, i);\n" +
    7971           1 : "    for (p = last(b); p != b; p = p->bk) {\n" +
    7972           1 : "      ++nblocks;\n" +
    7973           1 : "      avail += chunksize(p);\n" +
    7974           1 : "    }\n" +
    7975           1 : "  }\n" +
    7976           1 : "\n" +
    7977           1 : "  mi.smblks = nfastblocks;\n" +
    7978           1 : "  mi.ordblks = nblocks;\n" +
    7979           1 : "  mi.fordblks = avail;\n" +
    7980           1 : "  mi.uordblks = av->sbrked_mem - avail;\n" +
    7981           1 : "  mi.arena = av->sbrked_mem;\n" +
    7982           1 : "  mi.hblks = av->n_mmaps;\n" +
    7983           1 : "  mi.hblkhd = av->mmapped_mem;\n" +
    7984           1 : "  mi.fsmblks = fastavail;\n" +
    7985           1 : "  mi.keepcost = chunksize(av->top);\n" +
    7986           1 : "  mi.usmblks = av->max_total_mem;\n" +
    7987           1 : "  return mi;\n" +
    7988           1 : "}\n" +
    7989           1 : "\n" +
    7990           1 : "/*\n" +
    7991           1 : "  ------------------------------ malloc_stats ------------------------------\n" +
    7992           1 : "*/\n" +
    7993           1 : "\n" +
    7994           1 : "void mSTATs()\n" +
    7995           1 : "{\n" +
    7996           1 : "  struct mallinfo mi = mALLINFo();\n" +
    7997           1 : "\n" +
    7998           1 : "#ifdef WIN32\n" +
    7999           1 : "  {\n" +
    8000           1 : "    CHUNK_SIZE_T  free, reserved, committed;\n" +
    8001           1 : "    vminfo (&free, &reserved, &committed);\n" +
    8002           1 : "    fprintf(stderr, \"free bytes       = %10lu\\n\",\n" +
    8003           1 : "            free);\n" +
    8004           1 : "    fprintf(stderr, \"reserved bytes   = %10lu\\n\",\n" +
    8005           1 : "            reserved);\n" +
    8006           1 : "    fprintf(stderr, \"committed bytes  = %10lu\\n\",\n" +
    8007           1 : "            committed);\n" +
    8008           1 : "  }\n" +
    8009           1 : "#endif\n" +
    8010           1 : "\n" +
    8011           1 : "\n" +
    8012           1 : "  fprintf(stderr, \"max system bytes = %10lu\\n\",\n" +
    8013           1 : "          (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(mi.usmblks));\n" +
    8014           1 : "  fprintf(stderr, \"system bytes     = %10lu\\n\",\n" +
    8015           1 : "          (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(mi.arena + mi.hblkhd));\n" +
    8016           1 : "  fprintf(stderr, \"in use bytes     = %10lu\\n\",\n" +
    8017           1 : "          (CHUNK_SIZE_T)(mi.uordblks + mi.hblkhd));\n" +
    8018           1 : "\n" +
    8019           1 : "#ifdef WIN32\n" +
    8020           1 : "  {\n" +
    8021           1 : "    CHUNK_SIZE_T  kernel, user;\n" +
    8022           1 : "    if (cpuinfo (TRUE, &kernel, &user)) {\n" +
    8023           1 : "      fprintf(stderr, \"kernel ms        = %10lu\\n\",\n" +
    8024           1 : "              kernel);\n" +
    8025           1 : "      fprintf(stderr, \"user ms          = %10lu\\n\",\n" +
    8026           1 : "              user);\n" +
    8027           1 : "    }\n" +
    8028           1 : "  }\n" +
    8029           1 : "#endif\n" +
    8030           1 : "}\n" +
    8031           1 : "\n" +
    8032           1 : "\n" +
    8033           1 : "/*\n" +
    8034           1 : "  ------------------------------ mallopt ------------------------------\n" +
    8035           1 : "*/\n" +
    8036           1 : "\n" +
    8037           1 : "#if __STD_C\n" +
    8038           1 : "int mALLOPt(int param_number, int value)\n" +
    8039           1 : "#else\n" +
    8040           1 : "int mALLOPt(param_number, value) int param_number; int value;\n" +
    8041           1 : "#endif\n" +
    8042           1 : "{\n" +
    8043           1 : "  mstate av = get_malloc_state();\n" +
    8044           1 : "  /* Ensure initialization/consolidation */\n" +
    8045           1 : "  malloc_consolidate(av);\n" +
    8046           1 : "\n" +
    8047           1 : "  switch(param_number) {\n" +
    8048           1 : "  case M_MXFAST:\n" +
    8049           1 : "    if (value >= 0 && value <= MAX_FAST_SIZE) {\n" +
    8050           1 : "      set_max_fast(av, value);\n" +
    8051           1 : "      return 1;\n" +
    8052           1 : "    }\n" +
    8053           1 : "    else\n" +
    8054           1 : "      return 0;\n" +
    8055           1 : "\n" +
    8056           1 : "  case M_TRIM_THRESHOLD:\n" +
    8057           1 : "    av->trim_threshold = value;\n" +
    8058           1 : "    return 1;\n" +
    8059           1 : "\n" +
    8060           1 : "  case M_TOP_PAD:\n" +
    8061           1 : "    av->top_pad = value;\n" +
    8062           1 : "    return 1;\n" +
    8063           1 : "\n" +
    8064           1 : "  case M_MMAP_THRESHOLD:\n" +
    8065           1 : "    av->mmap_threshold = value;\n" +
    8066           1 : "    return 1;\n" +
    8067           1 : "\n" +
    8068           1 : "  case M_MMAP_MAX:\n" +
    8069           1 : "#if !HAVE_MMAP\n" +
    8070           1 : "    if (value != 0)\n" +
    8071           1 : "      return 0;\n" +
    8072           1 : "#endif\n" +
    8073           1 : "    av->n_mmaps_max = value;\n" +
    8074           1 : "    return 1;\n" +
    8075           1 : "\n" +
    8076           1 : "  default:\n" +
    8077           1 : "    return 0;\n" +
    8078           1 : "  }\n" +
    8079           1 : "}\n" +
    8080           1 : "\n" +
    8081           1 : "\n" +
    8082           1 : "/*\n" +
    8083           1 : "  -------------------- Alternative MORECORE functions --------------------\n" +
    8084           1 : "*/\n" +
    8085           1 : "\n") +
    8086           1 : (
    8087           1 : "\n" +
    8088           1 : "/*\n" +
    8089           1 : "  General Requirements for MORECORE.\n" +
    8090           1 : "\n" +
    8091           1 : "  The MORECORE function must have the following properties:\n" +
    8092           1 : "\n" +
    8093           1 : "  If MORECORE_CONTIGUOUS is false:\n" +
    8094           1 : "\n" +
    8095           1 : "    * MORECORE must allocate in multiples of pagesize. It will\n" +
    8096           1 : "      only be called with arguments that are multiples of pagesize.\n" +
    8097           1 : "\n" +
    8098           1 : "    * MORECORE(0) must return an address that is at least\n" +
    8099           1 : "      MALLOC_ALIGNMENT aligned. (Page-aligning always suffices.)\n" +
    8100           1 : "\n" +
    8101           1 : "  else (i.e. If MORECORE_CONTIGUOUS is true):\n" +
    8102           1 : "\n" +
    8103           1 : "    * Consecutive calls to MORECORE with positive arguments\n" +
    8104           1 : "      return increasing addresses, indicating that space has been\n" +
    8105           1 : "      contiguously extended.\n" +
    8106           1 : "\n" +
    8107           1 : "    * MORECORE need not allocate in multiples of pagesize.\n" +
    8108           1 : "      Calls to MORECORE need not have args of multiples of pagesize.\n" +
    8109           1 : "\n" +
    8110           1 : "    * MORECORE need not page-align.\n" +
    8111           1 : "\n" +
    8112           1 : "  In either case:\n" +
    8113           1 : "\n" +
    8114           1 : "    * MORECORE may allocate more memory than requested. (Or even less,\n" +
    8115           1 : "      but this will generally result in a malloc failure.)\n" +
    8116           1 : "\n" +
    8117           1 : "    * MORECORE must not allocate memory when given argument zero, but\n" +
    8118           1 : "      instead return one past the end address of memory from previous\n" +
    8119           1 : "      nonzero call. This malloc does NOT call MORECORE(0)\n" +
    8120           1 : "      until at least one call with positive arguments is made, so\n" +
    8121           1 : "      the initial value returned is not important.\n" +
    8122           1 : "\n" +
    8123           1 : "    * Even though consecutive calls to MORECORE need not return contiguous\n" +
    8124           1 : "      addresses, it must be OK for malloc'ed chunks to span multiple\n" +
    8125           1 : "      regions in those cases where they do happen to be contiguous.\n" +
    8126           1 : "\n" +
    8127           1 : "    * MORECORE need not handle negative arguments -- it may instead\n" +
    8128           1 : "      just return MORECORE_FAILURE when given negative arguments.\n" +
    8129           1 : "      Negative arguments are always multiples of pagesize. MORECORE\n" +
    8130           1 : "      must not misinterpret negative args as large positive unsigned\n" +
    8131           1 : "      args. You can suppress all such calls from even occurring by defining\n" +
    8132           1 : "      MORECORE_CANNOT_TRIM,\n" +
    8133           1 : "\n" +
    8134           1 : "  There is some variation across systems about the type of the\n" +
    8135           1 : "  argument to sbrk/MORECORE. If size_t is unsigned, then it cannot\n" +
    8136           1 : "  actually be size_t, because sbrk supports negative args, so it is\n" +
    8137           1 : "  normally the signed type of the same width as size_t (sometimes\n" +
    8138           1 : "  declared as \"intptr_t\", and sometimes \"ptrdiff_t\").  It doesn't much\n" +
    8139           1 : "  matter though. Internally, we use \"long\" as arguments, which should\n" +
    8140           1 : "  work across all reasonable possibilities.\n" +
    8141           1 : "\n" +
    8142           1 : "  Additionally, if MORECORE ever returns failure for a positive\n" +
    8143           1 : "  request, and HAVE_MMAP is true, then mmap is used as a noncontiguous\n" +
    8144           1 : "  system allocator. This is a useful backup strategy for systems with\n" +
    8145           1 : "  holes in address spaces -- in this case sbrk cannot contiguously\n" +
